She will invest in the purchase of a skimming machine that will help her in the processing and it will help her to generate more income. It will permit her to achieve her dream of providing her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy skimming machine.

loans.name: 35 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tình operates a food restaurant selling rice noodle. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

Tình is 54 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a three member group, the 35 Điện Biên solidarity group. Tình lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Tình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tình has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tình has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Tình faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tình hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her children to do well in school, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make processed food to sell

loans.name: Yaneth Odolid

texts.es: Yaneth Odolid de 42 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su esposo José de 47 años  y su pequeño hijo Luis de 7 años de edad. Yaneth  es una mujer emprendedora que día a día trabaja duramente para sacar adelante a su familia. Su sueño es dar a su hijo el estudio para que un día logre ser un gran profesional. Hace varios años que logro establecer una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia en la cual vende variedad de bebidas, cereales, golosinas, etc.  Además   también se dedica a la venta de pupusas, negocio que atiende solo por las noches. Es una mujer trabajadora que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus vecinos, los cuales cada día son más, gracias a su amabilidad y entrega en su trabajo. Solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para abastecer su negocio de variedad de productos como: arroz, frijoles, bebidas, lácteos, detergente, golosinas, papel y de mas productos que sean atractivos para los clientes. No pierde la esperanza que los resultados de su esfuerzo serán positivos y logrará obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yaneth Odolid is 42 years old and she lives in a house of her own together with her husband, Jose, who is 47 years old and their young son, Luis, who is 7 years old. Yaneth is a highly enterprising woman who works day after day to provide for her family. Her dream is to provide her children with schooling so that one day he will grow up to have a successful career. It has been many years since she established a small store where she lives. She sells a variety of drinks, cereals, snacks, etc. She also sells pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran dish made of corn dough stuffed with a variety of fillings). This business she only opens in the evenings. She is a hardworking woman who has always known how to earn her neighbor’s trust. She gains more clients daily thanks to her kindness and her commitment to her work. She requests this loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) to supply her business with a variety of products, such as: rice, beans, drinks, dairy products, detergents, snacks, paper products and other products which are attractive to clients. She does not lose hope that the results of her efforts will be positive, and obtain better income. She will aspire for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, drinks, dairy products, detergents, snacks, and paper products.

loans.name: Yaneth Maricela

texts.es: Yaneth Maricela, habita en casa propia con su compañero de vida Miguel y sus tres hijas las cuales se encuentran estudiando por el momento. Yaneth se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante. Las zonas donde se mueve con su venta son muy transitadas y de mucho comercio y gracias a su carisma ha sabido ganarse la confianza de muchas personas ya que ofrece variedad y buenos precios en los productos que ofrece. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de variedad de ropa interior para dama que es lo que más vende por el momento. Con esto espera lograr un incremento en sus ventas y por ende en sus ingresos con la fe puesta en Dios que así será y podrá dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yaneth Maricela lives in her own home together with her life partner, Miguel, and their three daughters, all of whom are currently in school. Yaneth sells clothing itinerantly. The locations where she travels with her sales are very well traveled and very commercialized. It is thanks to her charisma that she has been able to earn the trust of many. She offers variety and good prices on the products that she sells. She has taken the decision to request this loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). She will invest in the purchase of a variety of ladies' undergarments, the product that sells best at the moment. With this she hopes to increase her sales and hence, her income. Her faith is set on God to make this happen so that she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ladies' undergarments.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is 38 years old and married with two children. Her husband sells cooking gas containers. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. Oanh runs a general store from the doorway of her home. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as toys, soaps, perfumes, incenses and confectionery.

Oanh is requesting a loan to purchase a greater variety of products to sell. She would also like to use part of her loan to buy more gas containers for her husband to sell and expand his customer base. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase the income of her family and improve their well-being.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of stock for her general store.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida sews clothes for neighborhood clients to earn a living for her family. She is is 42 years old and married with a 6-year-old son who has not started his education yet. Her husband is a rickshaw driver providing transport services to passengers. He has been operating his transport business for the past 16 years. As a result, his rickshaw has grown old and on time maintenance is required.  

Therefore, Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband who will replace his rickshaw body with a new one and also do some repair work so it performs better. This will help him save his business asset and also allow him to provide better transport services to his customers. Khalida is hopeful that with the increased income her son will be able to attend school in the near future. She is a new loan applicant and very confident about her family’s bright future.

loans.use: buy a new rickshaw body and make some repairs.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en: Tuyet, 49, is married and earns a living to support her family by selling soup in her community. Her husband is a carpenter. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Tuyet has sold soup for five years. She plans to use this loan to buy meat and rice to make soup and to purchase wood and other materials for her husband to make furniture. In the future, she would like to expand her business by opening her own food stall and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy meat and rice to make soup and materials for her husband to make furniture.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban, de sesenta y siete años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa propia. El posee una venta de medicina natural y ya se hizo de mucha clientela porque lo que produce es muy confiable tiene muy buenas referencias de clientes anteriores. Don Esteban es un hombre carismático lleno de energía y con todo el entusiasmo de salir adelante; su trabajo constante y dedicación han hecho de él, una persona exitosa y triunfadora, está dispuesto a llenar de éxitos su vida es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ingredientes naturales como cola de caballo, manzanilla, llantén, sen, ajo, romero entre otros, asi podra seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de las personas que lo visitan.  Esteban tiene fe que su fuente de ingresos le ayude a darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Esteban is 77 years old and lives with his life partner and son in his own home.  He owns a natural medicines business and has a lot of customers because what he produces is very reliable.  He has very good references from previous customers.

Esteban is a charismatic man who is full of energy and all the enthusiasm he needs to get ahead.  His constant work and commitment have made him a successful man.  He is ready to fill his life with success and, for this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to buy natural ingredients such as field horsetail, chamomile, greater plantain, cassia senna, garlic, rosemary etc. so that he can continue meeting the needs of the people who visit him.  Esteban is confident that his source of income will help him to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy field horsetail, chamomile, greater plantain, cassia senna, garlic and rosemary

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en: Huong sells cooked food like sausages, rolls and roast duck in the market. She is married with two children. Huong was born in 1984. She lives in Tuan L. village, Tien D. commune. Her husband is a carpenter. She has had her business for three years. Her monthly income is about 3,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND). This is the first time she is taking part in SEDA. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy ducks. She is the leader of this six member group loan from SEDA. About other members in her group: Hoan is 33 years old. He has two children. He would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to grow vegetables. Phuc is 35 years old. He has three children. He would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to breed pigs. Ngan is 32 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy a tree. Ly is 35 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to grow vegetables. Hue is 28 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to grow vegetables.

loans.use: to buy ducks.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh has been earning money by selling soup to people in the local community for six years. Her family lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 35 and has two children: one son and one daughter. Her husband works for a restaurant. Anh would like to take out a loan to buy more meat, rice and spices to make more soup to sell. Anh hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice and spices to make soup to sell.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang and her husband earn an income by making bamboo beaded curtains at their house. Sang is 45 years old, married and has a son. She lives with her husband and son in Ho Chi Minh City.

Sang intends to use her loan to buy materials such as bamboo beads and silk thread to produce a greater number of different kinds of curtains. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve the family's living conditions and send her son to school.

loans.use: to buy materials such as bamboo beads and silk thread.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally, 45 years old, lives in Capellan, Ilagan, Isabela. She has a sari-sari store ( variety or general store) that sells snack food, groceries, soft drinks, and other daily basic needs. Her entrepreneurial idea started with the help of her husband and daughter. She was unemployed and her daughter helped her to provide the starting capital for her store. Through their discipline and persistent work, they have grown the business gradually until they have been able to turn it into an income stream that covers the family's daily living expenses. Their main challenge is having insufficient working capital to make cash purchases and take advantage of discounts that would increase their margins. This is why they have turned to KIVA for a loan.

Sally is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks and basic daily ingredients to sell. 

Sally's greatest goal in the future is to have a freezer for storing meat products so they will be able to respond more quickly to a growing number of customers' daily needs.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks and basic daily cooking ingredients to sell

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is a 39-year-old married woman with 2 children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Her husband is a driver. She has been selling beverages and beer in front of her house for 4 years. Their daily income is used to meet their family's basic needs. She needs a loan to provide her with capital to open a stall so that she can sell more beverages and beer for more customers.

loans.use: to have enough capital to open a stall where she can sell more beverages and beer

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is married, with two adult children. She’s 44 years old and lives in her own house in a rural area in Capellan, a developing area of Ilagan, Isabela. Leticia lives in a community that’s known for being a hospitable area.  Her main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. Leticia has been in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month.

Leticia has successfully repaid her previous loan from ASKI, which was used to invest in expanding the business. Leticia is requesting a new loan of PHP 15,000, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock and hog feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock and hog feeds

loans.name: Co

texts.en:
Co is a 51-year-old married woman with 2 children. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City.  Co has run a business selling thread for textile production for the past 2 years. Her husband is a truck driver.  

Co would like a loan to expand her business by purchasing a greater quantity and variety of thread as stock for her business. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of thread

loans.name: Lynn

texts.en:
Lynn  is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child.  Lynn  has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, breads and rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.
Lynn  has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lynn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna has a food vending business to earn a living. She also has a second business selling dried fish and clothing. Her main source of income comes from selling barbecued food in her community. She has been in this type of business for 25 years. She earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month from these activities.

Lorna is 46 years old and lives in the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of two school-age children.

Lorna has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase raw ingredients to barbecue and purchase kitchen utensils for food preparation. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Lorna hopes to expand her barbecue vending and have a stall in the city for food vending.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to barbecue and purchase kitchen utensils for food preparation.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 72 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of four adult children. Marcelina has a retail business to earn a living. Despite her age, she manages her business. Her main source of income comes from producing and selling charcoal in her community. She has been running her business for 25 years. Each month, she earns 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from the business. 

Marcelina has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making. Marcelina has been a member of GDMPC for over 10 years. In the future, Marcelina hopes to expand her business and  purchase a motorcycle to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih has been running his own plumbing business since 2004 and has more than 10 years of experience working in this field. He is a 30-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three school-aged children. He works independently and takes on projects in private homes and businesses. He is the main income source for the family. 

Today, Rabih is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in purchasing new materials needed for his projects. This may include pipes, bathroom fixtures, etc. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 25%.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing new materials needed for his projects.

loans.name: Tan

texts.en:
Tan, a 59 year-old single woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a business that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Tan requests a loan to purchase more products, such as soaps, candies, toilet paper, and shampoo to stock her store. That will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase general products such as soaps, candies, toilet paper and shampoo

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is married lady and a beautiful mother of two school-age children. She is 41 years old and lives in Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  To make a living, Conchita has a beauty salon.  Her income  comes from manicure and pedicure services, which she has been doing for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000.00 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP10,000 at GDMPC to purchase manicure and pedicure equipment.

Conchita has been member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Conchita hopes to gain more income from her services, and to have her own beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase manicure and pedicure equipment.

loans.name: Lanie Mae

texts.en:
Lanie Mae is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children.  Lanie Mae has a shop that sells canned goods, biscuits & snacks. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Lanie Mae has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lanie Mae hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Benyamin

texts.en:
Benyamin is a 42 year-old man, married to Diana, a 37 year-old lady. Their marriage has been blessed with four adorable children, namely Yeti, a sixteen year-old girl who is in the second year of senior high school; Fernando, a 14 year-old boy in the second year of junior high school; Samaria, an 11 year-old girl in the fourth grade of elementary school; and Frits, a 7 year-old boy in the second grade of elementary school.

Benyamin has been running a room rental business for seven years in order to fulfill the basic needs of his family.  His wife is working as a seamstress to assist him in generating money for their living. By setting up his unused rooms, he has attracted the students who come from countryside and want to continue study in the city, but don't have any relatives or place to stay.  They can rent a small room with access to clean water and electricity and pay IDR 75,000 on a monthly basis. 

Benyamin is dreaming of renovating his rental house but needs money to do so. He met TLM’s loan officer who promoted TLM’s lending program to the community in his village. Benyamin got interested in joining the program. He is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000. Benyamin is hoping that he gets the loan to purchase zinc, cement and other materials to renovate his rental house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate the rooms to be leased

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is married and a mother of three school-age dependents. She is 43 years old and lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
Susana has a retail shop at home to earn a living. She has been engaged in this type of selling for 8 years. She sells basic food items, like rice and corn grains, canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee and food in pouches.  Each month, she earns a total average of PHP 10,000.00 from this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell.  Susana has been member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Susana hopes to expand her retail business and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 45 years old and lives in Molicay, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of one school-age child.
Emma has a snack vending business.  She sells snacks, like pancakes, banana cue, and frozen fruit salad at the school.  She has been engaged in this type of business for 10 years. She earns PHP 5,000 each month from this work.  

She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 at GDMPC to purchase raw ingredients for snack preparation.  Emma has been member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Emma hopes to have more products to sell and have her own snack store.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for snack preparation.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 29 years old and is married, with 3 children. She earns about PHP 30,000 every harvest season.  Rowena grows rice and has been doing it for 3 years. Due to insufficient funds, she needs additional capital. She is asking for a loan of PHP12,000 which will be used to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer and insecticides.  Some of the loan will be used for the payment of the helper on the farm.

In the future, Rowena hopes to develop her rice farming business so that she can sustain the needs of her family and increase the profit she generates from her rice farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides and to pay for the helper

loans.name: Hanifamo

texts.ru: Ханифамо проживает в районе Хамадони. Ей 57 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Ее муж строитель. Сама Ханифамо занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже 20 лет. Она в основном закупает несколько телят, откармливает и продает их по более выгодной цене. Ханифамо берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота. Она хочет увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Hanifamo lives in the Hamadoni region. She is 57 years old and married. She has six children. Her husband is a construction worker. Hanifamo does animal husbandry. She has been in this business for twenty years. She mainly buys several calves, feeds them and sells them at a more profitable price. Hanifamo is taking out the loan to buy large horned cattle. She wants to increase their head count.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 25 years old and lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of one school-age child.
Christine is a farmer. She plants and harvests vegetables to earn a living.  She sells vegetables like eggplant, okra and pumpkins.  She has been farming for 7 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,500 from this work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to pay labor costs for land plowing.
Christine is a new member of GDMPC.  In the future, Christine hopes to gain more income and purchase additional land for vegetable production.

loans.use: To pay the labor cost for land plowing.

loans.name: Arvie

texts.en:
Arvie is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children.  Arvie has a shop that sells bags. She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional bags.  Arvie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Arvie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bags

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam, 41 years old, is married and has 2 sons. He supports his family through the income he earns from making screws. His wife is a worker in a garment factory. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nam intends to take a loan to buy iron pieces, an oven and cutting equipment to make screws to sell. The addiitonal material and equipment will enable him to increase his production of screws. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions and send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy iron pieces, oven and cutting equipment to make screws

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 25 years old, single, and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  Angie owns and operates a service-based business providing passenger services, which she has done for over three years.  Each month, she earns a total of PHP 4,000 from these activities.  

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to pay for the motorcycle registration renewal and maintenance.  Angie has been a member of GDMPc for three months. In the future, Angie hopes to purchase an additional motorcycle and add another business.

loans.use: To pay for the motorcycle registration renewal and maintenance.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.en:
Carmelo is 39 years old and lives in Carmen annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and a father of four school-age children.
Carmelo is a motorcycle taxi driver.  He owns and operates a  business providing passenger services. He has been in this business for ten years. He earns PHP 4,000 a month from these activities. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 at GDMPC to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.  Carmelo has been member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Carmelo hopes to expand his services and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 4 children.  Monica has a food shop that sells rice & cheese cakes. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients for the rice & cheese cakes.

Monica has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Monica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for the rice & cheese cakes

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a farmer and, at the same time, a business woman. She owns and operates a business selling fertilizers in her community. She has been in this type of business for over five years. Each month, she earns 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from the business.

Luciana is 58 years old and lives in Guingona, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of six adult dependents. 

Luciana has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Luciana hopes to expand her business and gain more profit for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 40-year-old single mother of five children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is vested with the responsibility of looking after her family and her dream is to educate her children up to university level. For ten years, Rebecca has been rearing pigs and chickens, and this has helped her pay school fees for her children. Her major challenge is the hiking [cost of] feeds, and her dream is to own 1000 birds as she currently has 200 birds.

Rebecca needs this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en:
Rubie is 21 years-old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a single mother to a school-age child and a baby.

To earn a living, Rubie has a retail shop at home.  For the last three years, she has sold biscuits, noodles, candies, food in pouches and canned goods.  This is the only income for the family.  Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from Kiva partner GDMPC in order to purchase additional products to sell.

Rubie has been member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Rubie hopes to gain more income from her business to use for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Juamonie

texts.en:
Juamonie is 28 year- old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Juamonie has a shop that sells t-shirts, blouses and beauty products from NATASHA and AVON. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 in order to buy additional products from NATASHA & AVON.

Juamonie has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Juamonie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products from NATASHA & AVON to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is married and the father of five adult children. He is 54 years-old and lives in Guingona, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Henry is a motorcycle taxi driver. He owns and operates a service-based business providing passenger services in the local community.

He has had this business for over five years.  Each month, he earn PHP 10,000.00 from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 15,000.00 from Kiva partner GDMPC in order to pay the labor cost for motorcycle repair and to purchase tires and spare parts.

Henry has been member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Henry hopes to gain more profits and purchase another motorcycle.

loans.use: to pay the labor cost for motorcycle repair and to purchase tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 50 years-old and is married with six children. She has been grateful because she is blessed with a responsible husband who really works hard for their rice farming business. Virgie is able to earn about PHP 6,000 monthly.

For the last 20 years, Virgie has grown rice. She is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 in order to provide additional capital to maintain the rice farming business. The loan will be very helpful in buying fertilizer, insecticides and a portion will be used for the payment for their helper. 

In the future, Virgie hopes to develop her rice farming business to be able to make it more productive for the second cropping.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and to pay their helper.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 53 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.

Arlene has a shop that sells electronic loads from several networks such as GLOBE and SMART. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 in order to buy additional electronic loads.

Arlene has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic loads.

loans.name: Nadiah

texts.en:
Nadiah is a 42-year-old single mother of four children. She lives in their permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of educating her children up to university.

Nadiah sells used clothing for a living and has been in this business for five years now. Her main challenge is lack of enough capital to meet the demands of her customers, and her dream is to own a boutique instead of operating on market stalls.

Nadiah needs the loan buy clothing for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Loc

texts.en:
Loc is a 41-year-old married woman with one daughter. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and daughter. Loc supports her family with income she earns from her small clothes-making business. Loc has run this shop for one year. Her husband is a worker in a garment factory.

Loc would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing fabric to make many different kinds of clothes to sell in the local market. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and help her neighbours to earn some income by working in her shop.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make many different kinds of clothes.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia has a shop that sells dried fish and rice by the kilogram. She is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Apolonia has had her business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional dried fish and rice to sell.

Apolonia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Apolonia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish and rice to sell.

loans.name: Fazilamo

texts.ru: Фазиламо проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 34 года. Она замужем. У нее имеется двое детей. Она более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа дойной коровы, чтобы увеличить количество скот.
texts.en: Fazilamo lives in the Hamadoni region. She is 34 years old and married. She has two children. She has been doing animal husbandry for more than fifteen years. She breeds cattle for future resale. Fazilamo is taking out the loan to buy a milk cow to increase the head count of cattle.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is a talented lady. She stitches hand bags for a home business. She collects order from different stores in the market and fulfills them on time to earn an income. She also sells bed sheets in her community. 

Her husband lives abroad and works there. Zahida has given birth to five children. Three of them work, while the others are students at a local school. 

Zahida has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for the further expansion of her bed sheet business. With the loan, she will buy bed sheets in larger numbers to sell. She has been operating this business for the past 20 years and is confident that after the loan investment her business will be further improved and her income will increase. She is very hopeful that she will be able to repay the loan easily after successfully improving her business. 

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Zahida.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien, 50 years old, is married and has two daughters. Hien and his family live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hien supports his family through the income he earns from silk-screen printing. Hien has worked as a silk-screen printer for 21 years. His wife also helps him to run the business. 

He intends to take a loan to buy better quality printing ink, frames and glue for fabric. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality printing ink, frames and glue

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en: Criselda is 34 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two grown children. Criselda is a farmer. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for meat purposes. She has been engaged in this business for three years. Every four months, she earns PHP 32,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase feed and additional piglets for fattening. Criselda has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Criselda hopes to raise pigs on a large scale and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and additional piglets for fattening

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en: A beautiful lady, Lalaine is 48 years old and lives in Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of two school-age children. Lalaine has a flower garden at home to earn a living. She has been engaged in planting and selling ornamental and flowering plants for eight years. She plants and sells flowers that are in high demand in the community like anthuruims, asters and roses. Each month she earns PHP 20,000 from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to purchase flower seeds, flower pots, and fertilizers. Laliane has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Lalaine hopes to gain more profit and purchase vacant land for a botanical garden.

loans.use: To purchase flower seeds, flower pots, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en: Bernadeth is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Bernadeth has a shop that sells beverages, canned goods & snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks. Bernadeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bernadeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Rosauro

texts.en: Rosauro is 69 years old and lives in Labo, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother of two adult-age dependents. Rosauro has a retail shop at home to earn a living. She sells personal products, food ingredients, and assorted food products. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years. Each month, she earns a total of PHP 10,000 from these activities. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell. Rosauro has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Rosauro hopes to expand her retail shop and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Gleseria

texts.en:
Gleseria is a married mother of seven school-aged children. She is 49 years old and lives in Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is a farmer. The main source of income for her agricultural business comes from the planting and harvesting of corn. She has been engaged in this business for over three years, and earns PHP 15,000 quarterly. 

Gleseria has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer.  She has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, she hopes to start another business and build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Radisa

texts.en:
Radisa is 36 years old and lives in Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has two school-age children. Radisa is a farmer. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes from planting and harvesting corn. She has been engaged in this business for over 15 years. Every quarter, she earn 13,200 PHP from this cultivation. She has requested a loan of  5,000 PHP at GDMPC, which she will use to purchase corn seeds and fertilizers.

Radisa has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Radisa hopes to expand her corn production and purchase additional land for corn plantation.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Liza May

texts.en: Liza May, a 51-year-old married mother of six children, lives in the Philippines where she has been operating a food shop that sells homemade sausage and chorizzo for the last five years. A new member of HSPFI, Liza May is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making more  sausage and chorizzo.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage and chorizzo.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha has been selling handmade women's accessories from her home since 2002. She is a 40-year-old married woman from Lebanon, living with her husband and three school-aged children. Her income is barely satisfactory, but she has to continue her business operation to provide her family with extra financial support. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her inventory of pearls and necklaces, etc. She is willing to diversify her merchandise collection to attract more customers and, therefore, increase her sales and income. In the future, she is hoping to open her own shop.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of pearls and necklaces.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 35 years old and lives in Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four school-aged children.

Yolanda is a farmer who owns and operates her own business. She plants and harvests corn to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for ten years. Each quarter, she earns about PHP 12,450 from her cultivation. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 at GDMPC to pay for the cost of soil-plowing labor and purchase fertilizers.

Yolanda has been member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, she hopes to expand her corn business and purchase land for corn production.

loans.use: To pay for soil-plowing labor and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 52 years old and lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a widowed mother of three adult children.

Adelaida is a farmer; she plants and harvests corn to earn a living.  She owns and operates her own agricultural business venture. Adelaida has been engaged in this business for over 15 years. Every quarter, she earns PHP 12,000 from this production. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers and corn seeds.

Adelaida has been member of GDMPC for six months. She hopes to increase her profit in the future and purchase farming equipment and buffalo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and corn seeds.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Margie has a food shop that sells homemade sausage and chorizo. She has had this business for 5 years. Margie has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making her homemade sausage.

Margie is a new member of HSPFI.  She hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making homemade sausage.

loans.name: Vian Jhon

texts.en:
Vian Jhon is 39 years old and lives in Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and a father of two school-aged children.

Vian Jhon is a motorcycle taxi driver who owns and operates his own business.  He provides passenger services to his local community. He has been engaged in this business for two years. Each month, he earns approximately PHP 10,000 from this work. 

Vian Jhon has been member of GDMPC for two years. He has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase a motorcycle sidecar. In the future, Vian John hopes to purchase another motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: To purchase a sidecar for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 46-year-old married woman with four children, living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to educate her children to university level. Stella is a director of a primary school and has been in this service for 3 years.

The major obstacle Stella encounters is too little capital to buy scholastic materials and too few classrooms to cater to the increasing number of pupils. Stella intends to use the loan she has requested to buy materials for construction, in order to build a block of classrooms.

loans.use: To bulid a classroom block.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married woman and a mother of three school-aged children. She is 43 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Josephine owns a service-based business, providing delivery truck services to her local community in order to make a living. Her delivery services are used in the distribution of corn and rice grains. Josephine has been engaged in this service for three years. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 every month from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to pay the labor costs to repair her delivery truck.

Josephine has been member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Josephine hopes to gain more income and establish a new business.

loans.use: pay the labor costs of repairing her delivery truck.

loans.name: Giau

texts.en:
Giau is 49 years old and married. She has two children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

Giau and her husband earn a living through their business selling aquarium fish. Giau has been in this business for seven years. She has requested a loan to increase the size of her business.  The loan will enable her to purchase more and different kinds of fish, food for fish, fish tanks, and an assortment of ornamental items and accessories for aquariums.  

Giau hopes that this loan will allow her to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, fish food, and accessories for aquariums.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Sonia has a retail shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional dried fish to sell. Sonia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Sonia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa is married and a mother of three grown children. She is 34 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jesusa has a food vending business to earn a living. She owns and operates a business selling fish in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for two years. Each month, she earns a total of PHP 5,000 from this activity. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase volumes of assorted fish to sell. Jesusa has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Jesusa hopes to gain more profit and purchase a vehicle to be used in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more assorted fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en: Rosana is 42 years old and lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of four school-age children. Rosana has a food business to make a living. She sells expensive fish in the local market everyday. She sells fish like blue marlin and tuna. She has been engaged in this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 from this activity. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase expensive fish to sell. Rosana has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Rosana hopes to gain more income from her business and purchase a motorcycle to be used for her business.

loans.use: To purchase expensive fish to sell.

loans.name: Oymgul

texts.ru: Оймгул проживает в районе Хамадони. Ей 51 год. Она замужем, имеет 5 детей. Ее муж художник, он занимается живописью. Сама Оймгул имеет среднее образование. Она занимается растениеводством. Сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. В этой области она уже 15 лет. Она берет кредит для повторного посева. То есть она хочет посеять дыню и арбуз.
texts.en: Oymgul lives in the Hamadoni region. She is 51 years old. She is married and has five children. Her husband is an artist and does painting. Oymgul has secondary education and she does agriculture. She sows wheat and grows vegetables. She has been in this business for fifteen years. She is taking out the loan to repeat sowing. She wants to sow melons and watermelons.

loans.use: to repeat sowing (to buy seeds)

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 46 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four school-age children.

Nida owns and operates a service-based business, providing passenger services in the local community. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from tricycle services. She has been engaged in this business for over six years.

Each month, she earn 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from these activities. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase a brand new tricycle for transport.

Nida has been member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to gain more income and purchase more tricycles for her services.

loans.use: to purchase a brand new tricycle for transport.

loans.name: Llyza

texts.en: Llyza has a retail shop that sells coconuts, bananas and lutya (a squash-like vegetable). She is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Llyza has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional bananas and coconuts to sell. Llyza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Llyza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Shiela Marie

texts.en:
Shiela Marie is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Shiela Marie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Shiela Marie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Shiela Marie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 35-year-old married man with three children. They live in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

Julius' dream is to build a permanent commercial house.

He has been operating a food store for eight years now, and his major challenge is inadequate capital to expand his store. Julius needs the Kiva loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is 50 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four adult dependents.

Virgincita sells dried fish to the local community. She has been engaged in this business for three years. She earn a total average of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from this business. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 at GDMPC to purchase dried fish to sell. Virgincita has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Virgincita hopes to expand her dried fish business and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Annaliza has a retail shop that sells tomatoes per kilogram. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy boxes of tomatoes to sell.

Annaliza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future,Annaliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 56 years old and lives in Cabunga-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four adult children.

Teofila has a small grocery store at home to earn a living. She sells personal products, assorted food products, dish-washing and laundry soap, food ingredients and seasonings in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She earns a total of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell.

Teofila has been member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Teofila hopes to expand her store and extend her store for entertainment.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is 31 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and a mother of one school-aged child.

Mae has a small market at home to earn a living. She sells basic food products like corn and rice grains, canned goods, noodles and dried fish. She has been engaged in selling for three years. Each month, she earns 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell.

Mae has been member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Mae hopes to expand her retail business and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Claire has a food shop that sells coconut wine and rice cake or biko. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for barbecue and banana cue.

Claire is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Claire hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for barbecue and banana cue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renew his tools and purchase an air compressor

loans.name: Marilet

texts.en:
Marilet is 33 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of four school-age children.

Marilet is a farmer. She owns and operates a business venture of planting and harvesting. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling banana fruit. She has been engaged in this type of business for five years. Each month, she earns a total of about 5,000 PHP (~$125) doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers and pay for the labor cost of weeding. Marelit has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her banana business and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pay the labor cost for weeding.

loans.name: Renedy

texts.en: Renedy is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Renedy has a shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy a stock of used clothing. Renedy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Maysaramo

texts.ru: Майсарамо жительница района Хамадони. Ей 56 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Она имеет среднее образование. При доме Майсарамо имеет небольшой земельный участок, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и топлива.
texts.en: Maysaramo is a resident of Hamadoni region. She is 56 years old and married. She has six children. She has secondary education. Maysaramo has a small plot of land by her house where she grows vegetables for sale. She has been in this business for twenty years. She is taking out the loan to buy seeds and fuel.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fuel

loans.name: Amado

texts.en:
Amado is 60 years old and is married with 9 children. He earns about 50,000 PHP (~$1175) every harvest season. He grows rice and has been doing so for 36 years. He is thankful because of the development of the farm he manages. He can see that his income is increasing now unlike before. To be able to maintain his rice farm he is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used for buying farm supplies such as fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for his farm.

Amado hopes to receive the loan amount he is requesting to further supply the needs of his family and to increase the profit he generates from his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 53 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and the mother of three adult-aged dependents.

Juana has a food business. She sells banana fruits to the local community to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for ten years. Each month, she earns approximately 15,000 PHP (~$350) from this activity. 

She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP at GDMPC to purchase a volume of banana fruit to sell. Juana has been member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to expand her fruit business and build her own fruit stand in the city.

loans.use: To purchase a volume of banana fruit to sell.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Esterlita has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and milk fish. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fish to sell. She is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Esterlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 59 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and the mother of four adult-aged children.
 
Teresita is a farmer. She owns and operates a business venture in agriculture. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and for meat purposes. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years. Three times a year, she earns about 60,000 PHP (~$1425) from this activity. 

She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP at GDMPC to purchase additional piglets for fattening. Teresita has been member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Teresita hopes to raise pigs on a large scale and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 47 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with four school-aged children.

Edgar is a farmer. He owns and operates a business venture in agriculture. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of his income comes from the raising of sows for producing multiple piglets to sell. He has been engaged in this business for five years. Twice a year, he earns approximately 60,000 PHP (~$1440) doing this type of activity. 

He has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP at GDMPC to purchase feeds and an additional sow for raising. Edgar has been member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, he hopes to expand his business into a large-scale operation and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase feed and an additional sow to raise.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 50 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and the mother of four adult-aged children.

She is a farmer. She owns and operates a business venture in planting and harvesting. She plants and harvests rice to make a living. She has been engaged in farming for 30 years, which is the only means of her subsistence. Every quarter, she earns approximately 30,000 PHP (~$712) from these activities.

Zenaida has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP at GDMPC to purchase fertilizers and pay for the labor cost of weeding. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to gain more income and purchase an additional rice field.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pay for the labor cost of weeding.

loans.name: Celerino

texts.en:
Celerino is 48 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with four school-age dependents.

He is a farmer. He owns and operates a business venture in planting and harvesting. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of his income comes from planting and harvesting rice.  He has been engaged in this business for 20 years. Every quarter, he earns approximately 45,000 PHP (~$1050) from doing this work. 

He has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC to pay for the labor costs of land preparation and rice planting. Celerino has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, he hopes to gain more income and purchase farm equipment.

loans.use: To pay for the labor cost of land preparation and rice planting.

loans.name: Ruqqiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqqiya is a supportive lady and sells clothes to financially support her family. Her clients include her community members who give her regular orders every month. Her husband has a business making plastic bottles. He receives orders from different factories and fulfills their orders on time to earn a profit. 

She has given birth to seven children. Three of them study and the others stay at home. Ruqqiya couldn’t provide education to all of her children due to financial constraints.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s bottle manufacturing business. With the loan, he will buy plastic and other material (used in making of plastic bottles) in larger quantity that will enable him to fulfill the orders on time. He has been operating his business for the past three years and Ruqqiya hopes that an investment will bring even more profits to him.

loans.use: To buy plastic & other required material for making plastic bottles

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret , age 31 years old, is married with one child. Margaret owns a saloon in Tala market where she provides her day to day service to customers. She has been doing this for the three years and gets an income of KES.12,000 per month. 

Margaret was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET officer.  She has a good credit history and she is applying for her third loan of KES.30, 000 from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the loan to buy weaves, cosmetics, lotions, dryer and other items for her beauty salon. 

She will use the extra profit to plough back into the business and to pay school fees.  She hopes to own an executive saloon.  She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy weaves, cosmetic, lotion, dryer and other items for the beauty salon

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 5 children. 

Mercy has a retail shop that sells dried fish.  She has had this business for 3 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy dried fish to sell.
Mercy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mercy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
Diosdado is 47 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.  He is married with four school-aged children.

Diosdado is a farmer.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of his income for the business comes from  planting rice and harvesting palay.  He has been engaged in this business for over 25 years.  Every quarter, he earn PHP 30,000.00 from these activities. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000.00 at GDMPC to purchase fertilizers and seedlings.  Diosdado has been member of GDMPC for one year.  In the future,Diosdado hopes to purchase additional rice fields and farm equipment.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 61 years old and lives in Calamba,Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is married and is the mother of three adult-age dependents.

Editha has a retail shop at home to earn a living.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of her income for the business comes from the selling of assorted food products in the local community.  She has been engaged in selling for over two years.  Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 from this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell.  Editha has been member of GDMPC for one year.  In the future, Editha hopes to expand her retail business and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Nixon

texts.en:
Nixon is 45 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.  He is happily married with three school-aged children.

Nixon is a farmer.  He plants rice and harvests palay to earn a living which is the only means of his subsistence for the family.  He has been engaged in this type of business for over 15 years.  Every quarter, he earn PHP 30,000.00 from this work.  He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000.00 from GDMPC to purchase organic fertilizers (chicken dung).

Nixon has been member of GDMPC for one year.  In the future, Nixon hopes to produce more palay and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers (chicken dung)

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 32-year-old married man with three children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in him and his desire is to build them a permanent house.

He sells cereals and rides a motorcycle for living. The major challenges faced are the high cost of farming, since he carries out his farming on a hired piece of land, and the mechanical breakdown of his motorcycle. He dreams of owning five motorcycles and a piece of land. Hassan intends to use the credit facility to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Lucy has a shop that sells rice by the kilogram. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Lucy has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lucy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is 56 years old and is married with 5 children. He is thankful because he is able to earn about 30,000 PHP per crop.

Virgilio grows rice and has been doing it for 31 years. He would like to develop his farm through borrowing additional capital from the lenders. In this regard, he is asking for a loan of 22,000 PHP for the maintenance of his rice farming business. He hopes that this loan amount will be approved for him to buy additional fertilizer, insecticides and seeds to grow.

In the future,Virgilio hopes that his farm will be more productive so that he could sustain all the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and seeds to grow for his farm

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad has had a bakery since 2006, where he makes all kinds of bread and pastries. He is 40 years old, married and has three children. Ahmad is from Iraq. He has good experience and a good reputation and is well known in his area. He is requesting a $2700 loan to buy a diesel generator. He is aiming to increase his income to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a diesel generator.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep, a 50-year-old woman, is divorced and has 2 children. She and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City.

To earn a living and provide for her children, Hiep has been selling food from her food stall for nearly 22 years. This business is the only source of income for her family. 

Hiep would like a loan to buy good quality raw meat, rice and fresh vegetables so she can cook many good dishes for her customers. She hopes that this loan will enabL. her to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice and fresh vegetables

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 46 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Баходур зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот у себя дома. В этой области он уже три года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Bahodur lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 46 years old. He is married and has five children. He has secondary education. Bahodur makes a living by breeding large horned cattle. He does this at home. He has been in this business for three years. Bahodur is taking out the loan to buy large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, salt, toothpaste, cooking oil, maize flour, beans, rice, plastic cups, etc. to resell

loans.name: Tanous

texts.en: Tanous is a 57-year-old married man from Lebanon, living with his wife and two young children who are still attending school. Despite his older age, he has been working as a taxi driver for the past 20 years. He operates a student van service in his town as well as in his neighboring villages. He also transports private clients upon their requests. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his van such as updating the paint, repairing the engine, etc. In the future, he is planning to purchase a new van and hire a part-time employee to work on it.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his van

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien, a 49-year-old married woman, has 3 children: 2 sons and 1 daughter. Her husband is a hired motorbike driver. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Lien supports her family through the income that she earns from the general store that occupies the front of her house. Lien has run a general store for over 20 years. She would like a loan to buy larger quantities of snack foods and basic household items in bulk for her general store. She hopes that this loan will enabL. her to increase her monthly profits.

She hopes that, as a result of the loan, her business will earn enough additional income for her to reinvest in her business and set aside savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of basic household items in bulk for her general store

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly, a 47-year-old married mother of six children, lives in the Philippines where, for the past six years, she has operated a shop that sells snacks, canned goods and beverages.  Having become a member of HSPFI this year, Beverly is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 42 years old and married with four children. With all four children in school, Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a business buying and selling Nipa palm fronds in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of Nipa palm fronds to sell. Elma has been in this business for two years.

In the future Elma would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of Nipa palm fronds to sell.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en: Roel, a 27-year-old married father of one, lives in the Philippines where he has operated a shop that sells beverages, canned goods and snacks for the past five years. A new member of HSPFI, he is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, beverages and snacks. In the future, Roel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia, a 57-year-old married mother of eight, works hard to provide for her family. She has operated a sari sari store in the Philippines for two  years and also earns an income from a computer shop. 

Emelia, who has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF, is now requesting a PHP 15000 loan to purchase additional items to sell in her store. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell. Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en:
Narciso is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 8 children. 

Narciso has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. He has had this business for 11 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Narciso is a new member of HSPFI.

In the future, Narciso hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Euvinia

texts.en:
Euvinia is 45 years old and married with four children. With all four children in school, Euvinia works very hard to provide for them.

Euvinia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, including shampoo and groceries, in her sari-sari store. Euvinia has been in this business for 18 years, and she sells a variety of items such as milk, soap, sugar, and canned goods.

In the future Euvinia would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is 43 years old and married. He is currently residing at the village of Bannawag Norte, Santiago City. The couple is blessed with 6 children; some of them have finished their tertiary level, while others are still studying. 

Bernardo would like to maintain his rice farm by asking for additional capital from the lenders. The loan will be useful in buying additional fertilizer, insecticides, and seeds to grow. He hopes that he could avail a loan of 30,000 PHP to help achieve his goals in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and seeds to grow

loans.name: Vizminda

texts.en:
Vizminda is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Vizminda has a retail shop that sells bread, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.Vizminda is a new member of HSPFI.  

In the future, Vizminda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 46 years old and married. She has four children, one of which is in school.

Jonalyn is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Jonalyn requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Jonalyn has been farming vegetables for two years now, and she has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Chien

texts.en:
Chien, 34, has 2 children. He lives with his children and wife in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife earns an income to support the family by selling fresh coconuts. Chien earns a living running a shop specializing in the repair and sale of electrical goods. He is an electrician and he repairs his customer's broken electrical goods and also sells reconditioned goods. He has been running his shop for 5 years.

Chien would like a loan to buy a range of different electrical goods to meet the demand of his customers and to attract new customers. He hopes that this loan will enable him to generate more income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods for resale

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Rosalia has a retail shop that sells hypo, or cleansing agent. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making hypo. Rosalia is a new member of HSPFI.  

In the future, Rosalia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making hypo (cleansing agent)

loans.name: Humaira's Group

texts.en:
Humaira is a very supportive lady. In order to support her husband financially, she does embroidery on clothes. She receives a good number of orders every month from her community clients. She also does clothes sewing work and offers her services at reasonable rates. Her husband works in a factory for a low income. Humaira has given birth to three children. Two of them study. Her youngest child is only three years old. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her clothes sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will help her fulfill the orders on time and earn better profits. She has been operating this business for the past eight years and has a good reputation among her clients for her good quality work. She hopes that with the new sewing machine, she will be able to work more efficiently and increase her income.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Humaira.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Serafin

texts.en: Forty-five-year-old Serafin. a married father of six, lives in the Philippines where, for the past five years, he has operated a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. A new member of HSPFI, he is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, beverages and snacks. In the future, Serafin hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en:
Thuan is 37 years old and married. She has two children and together with her husband, they live in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver. 

To earn a living, Thuan runs a general store from the front of her house. She has run her store for five years. She sells many kinds of basic products from her general store to serve her customers' daily needs.

She would like a loan to buy larger quantities of basic items in bulk to sell in her general store. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits and that in the future, she will be able set aside part of her income for family emergencies.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of basic items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Ophelia has a retail shop that sells detergents, canned goods & snacks. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy detergents, canned goods & beverages.

Ophelia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ophelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, canned goods & beverages

loans.name: 11 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Ms. Hương has a retail business selling general food and household commodities. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain her general store.

Hương is 40 years old and she is single with no children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 11 Điện Biên solidarity group. Hương lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
