Hương has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: To purchase materials to maintain a general store

loans.name: Annie Lou

texts.en:
Annie Lou is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Annie Lou has a retail shop that sells beverages, snacks & canned goods. She has had this business for 14 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Annie Lou is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Annie Lou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Aksante Mungu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Shabubake, leader du groupe d’affaire « Aksante Mungu »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 27 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est  pétrolière (vendeuse de carburant, essence, mazout en détail). En plus, elle vend aussi des souliers pour accroitre ses revenus. Son mari est un coiffeur, sociétaire d’un salon de coiffure (homme et dame). Elle installe ses marchandises au long de la boulevard  Karibu-Ulpgl. Il y a 5 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  10 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec 8 bidons de pétrole (essence, mazout) et 10 pairs de souliers. En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle pour y construire confortablement. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Aksante Mungu» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
Shabubake is an entrepreneur and the leader of the business group "Aksante Mungu". She's 27 years old, married, and the mother of four children, who all attend school. She retails fuel, gasoline and heating oil. In addition, she also sells shoes to increase her income. Her husband is a hairdresser, he co-owns a hair salon for men and women.

Shabubake sets up her merchandise along the Karibu-Ulpgl boulevard. She's been running this business for more than five years. She just completed her tenth loan with Kiva's partner, Hekima. This new loan will help her to buy 8 cans of gasoline and heating oil, as well as ten pairs of shoes.

Furthermore, she ambitions to send her children to school and buy a land lot for construction. She thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of the poor women who are excluded from classical banks. The business group "Aksante Mungu" is mostly made up of women.

loans.use: to buy 8 cans of gasoline and heating oil, as well as 10 pairs of shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more young coffee plants

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, a 57-year-old married woman, has four children. Her husband is a driver. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Van has had a general store in front of her house for five years. She sells many kinds of products such as confectionary, coffee, milk, and soaps.

She plans to take a loan to purchase more basic products to fully stock her general store. She hopes that this will enable her to better meet her customers' needs.

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate additional income to reinvest in her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase products such as coffee and confectionary for her general store

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

She has operated a clothes selling business for the past year, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. 

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu is to access loans to boost her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a photo cleaning machine and a computer.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is 36 years old, married and the mother of a son. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. Her husband operates a Punjabi food restaurant business. He has good taste in his hand and good behavior, which are the reasons he attracts his clients. He also has a good number of clients in his own area who come to his restaurant daily to eat the food items (Biryani, made with chicken and served with yogurt and Nan chany, made with chickpeas and served with bread).  

Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy the required ingredients to be able to prepare better quality food items and to serve more clients for better profits. Farzana is hopeful that the loan investment will help him expand his business and increase his profits. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Farzana.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make Punjabi food

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 42 years old, single and supports only his relatives. He has been a motorbike taxi businessman for the past year with a monthly income of KES 5,000.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  He will use the loan to buy another motorbike, which will increase his income.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy a rental car. His hope is concentrated on buying a rental car.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 27 years old and married to Christine, a charcoal dealer. They have one child aged five years. He has been running his business for the past three years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 31,200, which he saves and uses in both his business and his personal use.

He has been loaned KES.30,000 from KADET LTD. This is his first loan with KADET LTD. He intends to purchase fuel and spare parts. He plans to use the anticipated profit to restock fuel and spare parts.

His dream and hope is that he will be able to give his child a good life.

loans.use: To purchase fuel and spare parts

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne, aged 34, is married to Rashid who is a businessman. They are blessed with two children, aged five and seven years. She runs a boutique, which is her main business.  She also does catering alongside. The business has been in operation for four years.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She will use the funds to stock her boutique and buy catering utensils. Carolyne hopes to start importing clothes from other countries and to improve her catering skills in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her boutique

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Hottensiah

texts.en:
Hottensiah, 52 years old, is single with seven children. She has been running her business for the past nine years. She earns a monthly income of about KES 80,000, which she saves and uses in both her business and her personal use.

She has been loaned KES 40,000 from KADET Ltd. She intends to purchase kerosene, vegetables and fruits to sell in her grocery store. 

She plans to use the anticipated profit to put up rental houses on her farm. Her hope and dream is to be able to become a landlord.

loans.use: To purchase kerosene, vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, who is 58 years old, is a divorced mother of three children. Her children range in age from 22 to 32 years old. Jane owns a boutique as her main business. For the past 17 years, she has also run a cafeteria. She earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the funds to buy more utensils, tables, and seats for her cafeteria. She intends to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her grandchild. In the future, she hopes to own a modern restaurant.

loans.use: To buy utensils, tables, and seats for her cafeteria

loans.name: 3 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en: Ms. Huyến operates a restaurant selling rice noodles. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to process for food to sell. Huyến is 49 years old, and she is single with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependent. Huyến has been involved in her business for 8 years. The main hardship that Huyến faces in her business is lack of capital. Huyến is the group leader of the 3 Nam Ngan Solidarity Group, which consists of four members. This is Huyến first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Huyến hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to process for food to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, age 59 is married to James who is an accountant. She owns a boutique and also runs a tailoring business which has been in operation for eighteen years.The business earns her a monthly income of KES.37,000.

This is her first loan term with KADET LTD.She will use the funds to buy a machine for embroidery. Monica intends to use the anticipated profits to finish building her rental houses and hopes to export her embroidery materials to southern Sudan in the future.

loans.use: To buy a machine for embroidery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase dry maize, beans and green grams (mung beans).

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en: Onesmus is a married man. His wife is a farmer and they have 4 children between 15  and 2 years old. Onesmus runs a bookshop and his major customers are teachers and parents of school going children. He has been in this business for 6 years and has four employees. Onesmus hopes to use his loan to buy stationery to resell to his customers. He hopes to grow his business, open other bookshops in the area and possibly become the major supplier of stationery to the local schools. Onesmus describes himself as business like,charismatic, prudent and social.

loans.use: To buy stationery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add a stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour to her shop

loans.name: 10 Dien Bien Group

texts.en:
Thu is the group leader of the 10 Dien Bien solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. She is 49 years old and married with 2 children. She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. 

Thu has a laundry business. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. In 2009,Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. Thu is requesting a loan to purchase devices to maintain her laundry shop.

With her business profits, Thu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: To purchase devices to maintain her laundry business.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija, age 49, is a single mother of two children. She runs a salon-cum-beauty shop which has been in operation for 11 years. The business earns her a monthly income of 35,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). This is her first loan with KADET Ltd. She will use the loan to buy hair products for her salon and also to stock her beauty shop. She intends to use the expected profits to develop her piece of land and hopes to own a cosmetic shop in future.

loans.use: to buy hair products for her salon and beauty shop.

loans.name: Paulina Naf.

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha na Provincia de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique, casada e mãe de 1 filho de 2 anos de idade. Fez a 12ªclasse e se formou como professora. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo é professora ha 6 anos afecta na Escola de Mahelane no Distrito de Namaacha e tem um salario de 5.300.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem e cliente. este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para a sua obra (ferro, tabua, prancha,cimento, e outros ).O primeiro emprestimo foi de 20.000.00mt. 
Sonha em concluir a sua casa, mobilar e iniciar um negocio e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en: Paulina was born in the district of Namaacha in Maputo province in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of a two-year-old son. She finished the 12th grade and trained as a teacher. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. She's never left Mozambique. She's been a teacher for six years at the Mahelane school in Namaacha and earns 5300 meticals a month. She uses her salary for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account. She's never had a loan from other banks. She heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client. This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (rebar, lumber, cement, etc.). Her first loan was for 20,000 meticals. Her dream is to finish her house, furnish it, and start her own business, for which she will request additional loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (rebar, lumber, cement, etc.).

loans.name: David

texts.en: David has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years. He is 71 years old, married to Agnes and they have three children. He was introduced to KADET by a field officer, and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy more goods to sell in his retail shop and also to buy a hybrid dairy cow to diversify his sources of income. In the future, he hopes to extend his retail shop to wholesale and also progress in dairy farming to become a leading supplier of milk in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to add stock to his retail shop and buy a hybrid dairy cow.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze provincia de Gaza ao sul de Mocambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos de 9 a 24 anos de idade, os mais novos continuam a estudar. Fez a 9ªclasse e parou devido a problemas de saude. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Gaza para Maputo para continuar os estudos e veio sozinha. É funcionaria permanente do posto Administrativo da Machava em Maputo ha 26 anos e tem um negocio proprio onde  tem um salario de 2.900.00mt por mês e um rendimento d cerca de 3.000.00 no sei negocio que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, batata, farinha, oleo e outros ) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O primeiro emprestimo foi de 20.000.00mt. 
Sonha em concluir a sua casa, e ampliar o seu negocio e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Arminda was born in the district of Manjacaze in Gaza province in southern Mozambique. She is single and the mother of a four children between the ages of 9 and 24. She finished the 9th grade but had to leave school because of health problems. She lives with her family in her own home, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. 
She left Gaza for Maputo in order finish her studies. She has had a job in the town government of Machava in Maputo for 26 years. She also has her own business, where she earns a salary of 2900 meticals a month, and profits of around 3000. She uses her earnings for household expenses and is able to save a little in her bank account.
She's never had a loan from other banks. She heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 25,000 meticals, which she will use to buy goods (rice, sweet potatoes, flour, oil, and so on) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries. Her first loan was in the amount of 20,000 meticals.
Her dream is to finish her house and expand her business, for which she will request additional loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy goods for her shop (rice, sweet potatoes, flour, oil, and so on).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a computer and printer

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade da Beira, Provincia de Sofala, centro  de Mocambique é casado e pai de 3 filhos de 3 a 14 anos de idade, os dois mais velhos vaõ a escola. Fez a 9ªclasse e parou quando foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatorio. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Sofala para Maputo em missão de serviço, tem um negocio proprio e é funcionario permanente no Ministerio do interior ha 26 anos.  tem um salario de 8.600.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda do seu negocio consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 26.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material (ferro, pedra, areia,cimento, e outros ) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de 7.700.00mt, 12.000.00mt,14.000.00mt,e 25.000.00mt todos aplicados na habitação. 
Está confiante que vai pagar sem problemas e o seu sonho é de concluir a sua casa e mobiliar, no futuro pensa em comprar um carro para uso pessoal e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Jose was born in the city of Beira in Sofala province, in central Mozambique. He is married and the father of three children between the ages of 3 and 14. The two eldest attend school. He finished the 9th grade but had to drop out to complete his compulsory military service. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
He left Sofala for Maputo as a missionary. He owns his own business and has worked at the Ministry of the Interior for 26 years. He receives a salary of 8,600 meticals a month, which he uses to cover household expenses. He is also able to set aside a portion of his earnings in a savings account each month.
He's never had a loan from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his fifth loan from Hluvuku, in the amount of 26,000 meticals, which he will invest in supplies (rebar, stone, sand, cement, etc.) to continue the construction on his house. His first loans, in the amounts of 7,700, 12,000, 14,000, and 25,000 meticals, were all also used for his home.
He is confident that he will be able to pay off the loan without difficulty. His dream is to finish and furnish his house, and then buy a car for his personal use, for which he will request additional loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (rebar, stone, sand, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and some materials to add to her stock.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Balama, provincia de Cabo Delgado ao norte de Mocambique casado e pai de 3 filhos de 9 a 15 anos de idade todos vaõ a escola. Fez o nivel superior no ano de 2006. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Cabo Delgado para Maputo, quando foi transferido para trabalhar na Escola de sargentos, é professor nesta Escola ha mais de 16 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de 27.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja fez emprestimo no BIM para compra de uma viatura e pagou sem problemas. Mais tarde conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um colega que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, pedra, areia,cimento e outros) para continuar com a sua obra. O primeiro emprestimo foi de:20.000.00mt tambem aplicado na obra. 
Sonha em concluir a sua casa para dar mais conforto a sua familia e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Ricardo was born in the Balama district, in the Cabo Delgado province in northern Mozambique.  He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 9 and 15, all of whom attend school.  He completed college in 2006.  He owns his own home, where he lives with his family, and he does not support anyone else.  

He left Cabo Delgado for Maputo when he was transferred to work at Sargent's school.  He has been a professor in this school for more than 16 years and earns 27.000.00mt monthly, which he uses to cover household expenses.  He also saves some money in his bank account (BIM).  He previously had a loan through BIM to purchase a car and he paid it off without any problems.  he later learned about Hluvuku through a colleague who is also a client.  This is his second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt which he plans to use to purchase construction materials (iron, stones, sand, cement, etc) to continue construction on his home.  His first loan was for 20.000.00mt which was also used for the same purpose.  He dreams of finishing his home and making it more comfortable for his family.  He plans to request future loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (iron, stones, sand, cement etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products for sale (beans, peanuts, cooking oil, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Julio

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, provincia de Gaza ao sul de Mocambique casado  e pai de 4 filhos de 3 a 11 anos de idade os mais velhos vaõ a Escola. Fez a 7ªclasse e parou devido a falta de condiçoes financeiras apos a perda do seu pai. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Gaza para Maputo  com a sua familia devido a guerra civil mais tarde fixou sua residencia. Tem um negocio proprio de venda de produtos alimentares e bebidas alcoolicas ha 4 anos e tem um   rendimento mensal de cerca de 6.000.00mt, o mesmo que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa)
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, vinho, refrescos, feijaõ e outros ) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria e responder a demanda.
Esta confiante que vai pagar de acordo com o calendario estabelecido, futuramente pretende ampliar o seu negocio e comprar um carro para ajudar no escoamento do produto e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Julio was born in the district of Manjacaze, in the Gaza province of southern Mozambique.  He is married and has 4 children ages 3 to 11.  The eldest attend school.  He completed school through the seventh grade but dropped out due to financial circumstances after the death of his father. He lives in his own home with his family and does not support anyone else.  

He left Gaza for Maputo with his family due to the civil war and later established residence there.  He has had his own business selling groceries and alcoholic beverages for four years and he earns around 6.000.00mt per month.  He uses this money to cover his household expenses and he saves some through Xitique, a traditional method of community savings. 

Julio has never had a loan in other banks.  He learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which he will use to purchase products (beer, wine, soft drinks, beans, etc.) to increase his stock and respond to customer demand.  

He is confident that he will make his payments on time.  In the future he would like to expand his business and purchase a car to help transport products. He plans to request further loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: topurchase products for sale (beer, wine, softdrinks, beans, etc.)

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 46 years old and married to Nelson, who owns a transportation truck. Together they have three children. She has been running her farming business for the past nine years. She earns a monthly income of about 100,000 KES, which she saves and uses both for business and personal needs.

She has been loaned 80,000 KES from KADET Ltd. This is her fourth loan from KADET. She intends to use the loan to purchase a dairy cow. Rhoda has good credit history with KADET LTD.

She plans to use the anticipated profit to expand her business and to finish her rental houses. She hopes to be able to meet her family's needs through the income of her rental houses in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Augusto

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha provincia de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique casado  e pai de 2 filhos de 4 e 12 anos de idade o mais velho vai a Escola. Fez 8ªclasse e parou devido a falta de condiçoes financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Namaacha para Maputo a procura de emprego, trabalha como  motorista permanente numa empresa privada ha mais de 10 anos e tem um   rendimento mensal de 8.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar matrial  de construção (cimento, ferro, pedra, areia, e outros ) para continuar a construir a sua casa.
Sonha em concluir a sua obra, mobiliar e iniciar outra obra para aluguer e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Augusto was born in the Namaacha district in the Maputo province in southern Mozambique.  He is married and has two children, ages 4 and 12.  The older child attends school.  Augusto attended school through the 8th grade but dropped out due to financial circumstances.  He lives in his own home with his family and does not support anyone else.  

He left Namaacha for Maputo to look for work.  He has worked for 10 years as a driver for a private company and has a monthly salary of 8.000.00mt which he uses to cover household expenses and for savings in his bank account. 

Augusto has never had a loan with other banks.  He learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15.000.00mt, which he will use to purchase construction materials (cement, iron, stones, sand, etc.) to continue construction on his home.  He dreams of completing his home, furnishing it, and building another one to rent.  He plans to request more loans from Hluvuku for this purpose.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials ( cement, iron, stones, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 51 years old and married to Susan. The couple is blessed with seven children. Danilo is thankful that his wife helps him to manage their rice farm. According to him, he is able to earn about 30,000 PHP every harvest season.

Danilo grows rice and has been doing this for 21 years. Due to insufficient capital, Danilo was encouraged to join ASKI and be part of their organization. He is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to further improve his rice farming business. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides for his farm. He hopes that his loan request will be granted.

In the future, Danilo hopes to continue to improve his farm so that his profit will increase.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for his farm

loans.name: 54 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan has a retail business selling food and general household items. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain the inventory of her general store.

Loan is 40 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. 

She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 54 Điện Biên solidarity group, that is requesting a group loan. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Loan has been involved in her general store business for six years. The main challenge that she faces in her business is a lack of capital. In the future, Loan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her general store

loans.name: Mukisa Development Group

texts.en:
Thirty years running a successful tailoring business is no easy accomplishment. But a certain enterprising 48-year-old lady, who goes by the name of Joyce, has notched it. She operates in Mpigi. Longevity is not something most people talk about when they are discussing this kind of business. Most people involved in this business face stiff competition from local textile industries and the secondhand clothing markets. Most of the clothes they sew may not even be bought, if the price is not that pocket favorable. Most people would rather make do with secondhand clothing. This, however, was not a factor that could dampen Joyce's spirits 30 years ago, when she sought to earn her keep and obtain a footing in this business.

She has, by and large, had a chequered experience running this business. At the beginning, she was mostly sewing school uniforms for schools. With time, she diversified and starting sewing all sorts of clothes to sell. With orders from schools increasing, and her other clothes (mostly lady's clothes) selling favorably in her shop, Joyce knew that, with determination, she could make headway. The new lease on life in her business was translating into better sales profits. Given her nature, however, she could not rest on her laurels. This is one attribute which has kept her business afloat. Most of her friends say she is never complacent.

Weekly, her business sales revenue totals up to 60,000 Ugandan shillings. This is modest by her standards but she remains upbeat. The economic status quo in the country as of now is adverse and she knows most people are facing it tough. Once the situation improves, she envisages better conditions for her business. For Joyce's group, this is their second loan cycle. Joyce says she is requesting this Kiva loan money to purchase more clothes-making textile materials. With this, she reckons she will be able to make more clothes and school uniforms to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes-making textile materials.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, provincia de mesmo nome, sul de Mocambique casada e mãe de 4 filhos de 9 a 25 anos de idade todos vão a Escola. Fez a 7ªclasse e parou devido a falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua sogra que vive com ela.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, apenas foi visitar o marido na Republica da Africa do sul onde trabalha. É  negociante ambulante ha 6 anos e vende roupa diversa e sapatos onde tem um rendimento mensal de 5.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu Hluvuku atravez de irmãos que tambem são clientes e este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (camisolas, sapatos, meias, e outros ) para aumentar a sua mercadoria e responder a demanda.
Sonha em ampliar o seu negocio e construir o seu proprio estabelecimento, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Gloria was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique.  She is married and has 4 children, ages 9 to 25, all of whom attend school.   Goria attended school through the 7th grade but dropped out due to financial circumstances.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her mother-in-law, who lives with her.  

She has never left Maputo, except to visit her husband in South Africa, where he works.  She is a traveling salesperson and for the past 6 years she has sold clothing and shoes.  She has monthly earnings of 5.000.00mt which she uses for household expenses and savings in her bank account (BIM).  She has never had a loan in other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through her siblings who are also clients.  This is her third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt.  She will use it to purchase products (camisoles, shoes, socks, etc.) to increase her stock and meet customer demand.

Gloria dreams of expanding her business and building her own shop, and intends to request additional loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for sale (camisoles, shoes, socks, etc.).

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Barue, Provincia de Manica, centro de Mocambique viuva e mãe de 3 filhos de 17 a 27 anos de idade. Fez a 3ªclasse e parou devido a falta de condiçoes financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Manica para Maputo quando foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatorio, é pensionista no Ministerio da defesa nacional ha 20 anos e tem uma pensão de 5.140.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Ja fez emprestimo no TCHUMA no valor de 4.000.00mt que aplicou para iniciar a sua obra, mais tarde conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia,pedra, e outros ) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
Esta confiante que vai pagar bem, futuramente pretende iniciar um negocio proprio e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Maria was born in the District of Barue, Manica Province, in the centre of Mozambique. She is a widow and mother of 3 children from 17 to 27 years of age. She completed 3rd grade and stopped due to lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.
She left Manica for Maputo when she was enrolled in the mandatory military service and has been a Ministry of Defense pensioner for the last 20 years with a pension of 5,140 meticals (MZN) a month, which she uses for household expenses and some of which she saves in her bank account.
She has already had a loan from TCHUMA for the value of 4,000MZN which she used to start her building work. Later she was introduced to Hluvuku through friends who are also Hluvuku clients. This is her second Hluvuku loan for the value of 20,000MZN, with which she intends to purchase building materials (cement, iron, stone and others) to continue building her house.
She is confident she will pay back the loan and in future intends to start her own business for which she will request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: Purchase building materials (cement, iron, stone and others) to continue building her house

loans.name: Veronica

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Milange Provincia de Zambezia ao norte de Mocambique, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 7 a 20 anos de idade todos Vão a Escola. Fez a 5ªclasse e parou devido a falta de condiçoes financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Zambezia para Maputo ainda pequena com os seus pais, mais tarde formou o seu proprio lar. É negociante ha  mais de 12 anos, vende produtos diversos e bebidas onde consegue um rendimento mensal de 7.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu Hluvuku atravez de vizinhos que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 17.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (colgate, amendoim, omo,refresco, e outros ) para aumentar a quantidade da mercadoria. O emprestimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt e aplicou no comercio.
Vai pagar de acordo com calendario e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos para comprar uma viatura e para tal tenciona solicitar a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in Milange District, Zambezia Province in northern Mozambique. She is married and has three children between the ages of 7 and 20; all the children go to school. Veronica finished fifth grade and quit school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left Zambezia to move to Maputo with her parents when she was young, and later she made her own home. She has been a businesswoman for more than 12 years. She sells assorted products and drinks, and she earns a monthly income of 7,000 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank acount (at BIM).

Veronica has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through neighbors who are also customers of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. She is asking for 17,000 meticais, which she will use to buy products (Colgate, peanuts, Omo laundry soap, soft drinks and other items) to increase her inventory. The earlier loan was for 10,000 meticais and was used for business.

Veronica will make her payments as scheduled, and in the future she intends to ask for more loans to buy a vehicle, and to do that she will ask Hluvuku for loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (Colgate, peanuts, Omo laundry soap, soft drinks, etc.).

loans.name: Florinda

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, Provincia de mesmo nome, sul de Mocambique é casada e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais não lembra as respectivas idades. Fez a 2ªclasse e parou devido a falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus netos que vivem com ela.
Nunca saiu de Maputo sua terra natal, é negociante a bastante tempo e vende produtos de primeira necessidade e consegue um rendimento mensal de cerca de 8.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu Hluvuku atravez de vizinhos que tambem são clientes e este é o seu segundo emprestimo na instituição no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos para revenda (cervejas, amendoim, omo,refresco, e outros ). O  primeiro emprestimo foi de 10.000.00mt,tambem para o negocio.
Sonha em ampliar o seu negocio para um nivel de Estabelecimento como forma de aumentar os lucros e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has four children, whose ages she does not remember. Florinda finished second grade and quit school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her grandchildren, who live with her.

She has never left Maputo, her hometown. She has been a businesswoman for quite some time and sells staple goods. She earns a monthly income of around 8,000 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. She saves some money in her bank account.

Florinda has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through neighbors who are also customers, and this is her second loan from the institution. She is asking for 16,000 meticais, which she will use to buy products for resale (beer, peanuts, Omo laundry soap, soft drinks and other items). The first loan, also for the business, was for 10,000 meticais.

Florinda dreams of expanding her business into an "establishment" as a way to increase her profits, and to do this she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and resell products (beer, peanuts, Omo laundry soap, soft drinks, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell products (crackers, peanuts, Omo laundry soap, soft drinks, etc.).

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 32 years old and married. He has two children, 3 and 2 years old. His wife, Priscilla, helps him run the butcher shop that is their secondary business. He has been running this businesses for the past four years and earns a monthly income of about 75,000 KES. He uses some of his income for business and personal needs, and he saves some of it. 

He has been loaned 30,000 KES from KADET Ltd. This is his first loan with KADET Ltd. He intends to use the loan to purchase goats for slaughter. With the anticipated profit, he plans to increase his savings and reinvest in the business.

His dream is to be able to educate his children and earn a decent living to provide for them.

loans.use: to buy goats for slaughter and sale.

loans.name: 17 Ngô Quyền Group

texts.en: Mrs. Lan has a business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain her business. Lan is 37 years old and married with two children. Lan lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Lan has been involved in her business for five years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is lack of capital. In 2009, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Lan hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids. She wants her children to do well in school and for her business to do well. Mrs. Lan is the leader of a six member group, the 17 Ngô Quyền Solidarity Group.

loans.use: to purchase materials for tailoring clothes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 47 years old and married to Zablon. She has been running her business for the past 12 years. She earns a monthly income of about 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she saves and uses both in her business and for personal use.

She has been loaned KES 60,000 from KADET Ltd. This is her fourth loan from KADET LTD.

She intends to use the loan to purchase stock of clothes for sale and raw material for making hair wax for sale in her second business.

She plans to use the anticipated profit to expand her business and support her family. Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business with steady income.

loans.use: To buy stock of clothes for sale and raw material for making hair wax for sale.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Chokwe provincia de Gaza, ao sul de Mocambique viuva e mãe de 2 filhos de idades entre 4 e 24 anos de idade. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Gaza para Maputo com os seus pais, é negociante ha 22 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de 4.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos.Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem são clientes e este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 9.000.00mt, com qual pretende pagar matricular o seu filho na escola de  condução. Os primeiros  emprestimos  foram de 10.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt foram para o negocio.
Sonha em ampliar o seu negocio e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Beatriz was born in Chokwe District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. She is widowed and has two children who are 4 and 24 years old. Beatriz finished seventh grade and quit school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left Gaza to move to Maputo with her parents. She has been a businesswoman for 22 years and has a monthly income of 4,000 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account (at BIM).

Beatriz has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers. This is her fourth loan from Hluvuku, and she is asking for 9,000 meticais, which she will use to pay for her son's enrollment in driving school. The earlier loans were for 10,000 meticais, 12,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais and were for the business.

Beatriz dreams of expanding her business, and to do so she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to pay for her son's enrollment in driving school.

loans.name: Rui

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namacura provincia de Zambezia ao norte de Mocambique viuvo e pai de 3 filhos de idades entre 2 a 13 anos de idade.Fez a 9ª classe e continua a estudar. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ela.
Saiu de Zambezia para Maputo devido o serviço militar obrigatorio, e segurança da G4S a 12 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de 2.350.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos.Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem são clientes e este e o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 11.100.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para a sua obra construcao de uma casa, ou seja, moradia (chapas, areia, cimento, ferro, e outros ),os primeiros  emprestimos  foram de: 8.000.00mt, 10.500.00mt, 12.000.00mt, e 15.000.00mt.
Sonha em ampliar a sua casa,mobiliar para oferecer melhor conforto a sua familia e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Rui was born in Namacura District, Zambezia Province in northern Mozambique. He is widowed and has three children between the ages of 2 and 13. Rui finished ninth grade and still studies. He lives in his own house with his family and supports a nephew who lives with him.

Rui left Zambezia to go to Maputo because of his obligatory military service. For 12 years he has been a security guard with G4S and has a monthly income of 2,350 meticais. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account (at BIM).

Rui has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through neighbors who are also customers. This is his fifth loan from Hluvuku. He is asking for 11,100 meticais to buy building materials (zinc sheets, sand, cement, iron and other items) for his housing project. The earlier loans were for 8,000 meticais, 10,500 meticais, 12,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais.

He dreams of expanding his house and furnishing it to make his family more comfortable. To do so he intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy building materials (zinc sheets, sand, cement, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 24 years old and single. He has been running his  businesses for one year. He earns a monthly income of about 7,700 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he saves and uses both in his business and for personal use.

He has been loaned KES 10,000 from KADET Ltd. This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. He intends to purchase a cow, and he plans to use the anticipated profit to buy piglets for rearing.

His dream and hopes are that he will be able to operate his own large-scale farm.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Ana Paula

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Maputo, tem 34 anos de idade vive maritalmente, é mãe de 3 filhos dos 04 aos 17 anos, todos vão a Escola. Fez a 7ªclasse não continuou devido a guerra, vive na casa própria com sua familia e não responsabiliza se por ninguem.

Após a guerra ela começa atrabalhar na tentativa de ajudar a sua mãe com as dispesas da casa porque ela é a mais velha e tinha que cuidar dos mais novos, quando junta se com seu marido consegue aranjar um emprego no Colégio Maria Auxiliadora uma Escola lecionada pelas Irmãs Salesianas como Monitora das crianças dos 3 anos( no Centro Infantil) é contratada ja a 3 anos renovando o contrato anualmente. Trabalha das 7.00h as 15.00h auferindo mensalmente 2.473.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra. Conta com ajuda do seu marido que é alfaiate.

Nunca trabalhou com outros Bancos, este é seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( cimento, areia e outros) para conclusão da sua obra. Pretende pagar cem nenhum problema para aceder a outros empréstimos no futuro.
texts.en:
She was born in the Maputo province.  She is 34-years-old, is married, and is the mother to three children ranging from four to 17-years-old, all of whom go to school.  She completed her seventh year of schooling but didn’t finish school because of the war.  She lives in her own home with her family and isn’t responsible for anyone else.

After the war she began to work to try to help her mother with household expenses because she is the oldest and had to care for the younger children.  Her husband helped her get a job in the Colégio Maria Auxiliadora, a school taught by the Salesian Nuns, where she works as a monitor supervising the three-year-old children in the Children’s Center.  She has now worked with them for three years on an annual contract that is renewed every year.  She works from 7AM to 3PM earning 2,473 meticais (currency of Mozambique) monthly which she uses for household expenses and construction costs.  She also has the help of her husband who is a tailor. 

She has never worked with other banks, this is her first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 10,000 meticais which she plans to use to buy construction materials (cement, sand, and others) to finish working on her house.  She plans to pay it back with no problems in order to have access to other loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy construction material (cement, sand, and others).

loans.name: Clementine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 48 ans, celibataire avec 5 enfants a sa charge dont l'age varie entre 12 et 26 ans.Depuis 24 ans , elle s'est lance dans la vente des planches, ses potentiels clients sont les menuisiers et charpentiers qui sont dans son quartier situe non loin d'un grand marche.
Ses ventes sont de 50.000frs a plus de 100.000 frs par jour.

A l'octroi de son pret elle va renforcer le stock des planches te que achat de 20 bastins de 10m, 20 bastings de 8 m, 50 contre plaques de 6m, lots de lattes de 6m et 50 chevrons 5m, 6m, et 7m.

A l'avenir, avec ses benefices elle veut agrandir son depot et aller au nord du pays pour aller acheter en gros  des convois de planches dans les societes forestieres et acheter aussi des scies moteurs pour le coupage du bois.
texts.en:
Clémentine, age 48, is unmarried and has 5 children to support, aged 12 to 26. She started selling planks 24 years ago, her potential customers are furniture makers and carpenters in her neighborhood, not far from a large marketplace. Her daily sales range from XOF 50'000 to 100'000 (ca US$ 100 to 200).

With her loan, she will bolster her stock by buying 10- and 8-meter planks (20 pieces of each), 50 pieces of plywood (6 meters), bundles of laths (6 meters), and 50 rafters (5, 6 and 7 meters).

In the future, she wants to use her profits to expand her depot, and travel to the north of the country in order to buy truckloads of planks wholesale from forest companies. She also would like to buy motored saws for cutting wood.

loans.use: to buy plywood, planks, laths, and rafters

loans.name: Felizardo

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Cabo Delgado a Norte de Moçambique, tem 29 anos de idade vive maritalmente, fez a 10ª classe não continuou devido a sua ida a tropa, é pai de 3 filhos de 02 aos 07 anos dois vão a Escola Vive na casa própria com sua familia e não responsabiliza se por ninguem.

E incorporado na vida militar durante 3 anos e passa a fazer parte dos Agentes da Guarda Fronteira concretamente no Distrito de Namaacha onde fixa sua residência. É funcionario permanente ha mais de 5 anos, trabalha das 7.00h as 15.00h na area de Logistica e Finanças auferindo mensalmente 5.649.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra. Mas também conta com ajuda da sua esposa que é funcionária no Hotel Libombos no mesmo Distrito e consegue por vezes poupar 1.000.00mt na sua conta bancaria.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar Material de Construção(cimento, blocos ,areia e mais ) para dar continuidade da sua obra  . Ja trabalhou com o BIM e conhece a Hluvuku atraves da sua esposa que também é cliente da instituição, pretende pagar cem nehum problema para aceder a outros créditos.
texts.en:
He was born in the Cabo Delgado province in the north of Mozambique.  He is 29-years-old, married, and completed his 10th year of schooling and didn’t continue because he joined the military.  He is the father to three children ranging from two to seven-years-old.  Two are in school.  He lives in his own home with his family and is not responsible for anyone else.  

He has been a part of the military for three years and has become a part of the Border Guard Agents, specifically in the Namaacha district where he lives.  He has been a permanent employee for more than five years and works from 7AM to 3Pm in the Logistics and Finances area earning 5,649 meticais (Mozambique currency) monthly which he uses for household and construction expenses.  He also has the help of his wife who is an employee in the Libombos Hotel in the same district and who can sometimes save 1,000 meticais in their bank account.

This is his first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 10,000 meticais which he intends to use to buy construction materials (cement, blocks, sand, and more) to continue with his project.  He has already worked with the World Bank and he heard about Hluvuki through his wife who is also a customer of the institution and plans to make his payments without any problems in order to have access to other loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, blocks, sand, and more).

loans.name: Xavier

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Zambézia, tem 45 anos de idade é casado, pai de 3 filhos  de 8 aos 18 anos de idade, todos  vão a Escola. fez o Ensino Médio não deu continuidade devido a distância que o separa de casa a Universidade. Responsabiliza se pelos seus pais que vivem em Zambézia enviando lhes em cada semestre 2.000.00mt.

 E recrutado para tropa, compriu 2 anos, e de seguida faz um curso de formação Básica intensivo nas Forças Armadas.Hoje é Policia, auferindo mensalmente no valor de 5.500.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa. Com ajuda da sua esposa conseguem construir uma capoeira e iniciar a criação de pintos para aumentar a renda familiar, tem criado por média 4x100 caixas de pintos gastando um valor de 30.000.00mt e tendo de lucro de 10.000.00mt dependendo muito mais das mortalidades e o tempo de venda.

Este é o quinto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende adquirir mais pintos para criação. Os anteriores de (14.000,00 ,15.000,00, 22.000.00)mt foram para a criação, esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir uma novo para aumentar a sua capoeira e fazer a criação de novas especies tais como perus, patos e gansos.
texts.en:
He was born in the Zambézia province and is 45-years-old, married, and is the father of three children ranging from eight to 18-years-old, all of whom are in school.  He completed secondary school but did not continue because of the distance separating his house from the University.  He is responsible for his parents who live in Zambézia and sends them 2,000 meticais (Mozambique currency) every semester.  

He was recruited for the military, signed on for two years, and following this did a basic training course in the Armed Forces.  Now he is in the police force earning 5,500 meticais monthly which he uses for household expenses.  With the help of his wife he was able to build a poultry house and begin to raise chickens to increase the family income.  They raise on average four boxes of 100 chickens, spending 30,000 meticais and having a profit of 10,000 meticais depending greatly on the number of deaths and the time necessary to sell them. 

This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15,000 meticais which he plans to use to acquire more chickens to raise.  The other loans (in the amount of 14,000, 15,000, and 22,000 meticais) were for raising chickens as well.  He is confident that he will repay it before the set time and request a new one to expand his poultry house and begin raising new species like turkeys, ducks, and geese.

loans.use: to raise poultry (chickens).

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha  Provincia de Maputo tem 33 anos de idade vive maritalmente fez a 6ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras, é pai de 1 filha de 12 anos que vai a Escola. Vive numa casa alugada e sustenta seu irmão que vive com ele em sua casa. 

 Começa a trabalhar no Hotel Xisaka como Tecnico de Manutenção de Maguinas, consegue fixar sua propria casa. Trabalha  ha mais de 6 anos. Aufere por mês 3.500.00mt, que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra. Para além do trabalho nos seus tempos livres ele tem ido a fronteira da swazilandia onde são solicitados para transportar carros que vem da Africa do Sul( carros de dubai) ate a capital Maputo,  ganhando por viagem 500.00mt. 

Este é o quinto empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( cimento, areia, barrotes portas e mais) para dar continuidade da sua obra. Os anteriores de 3.500.00mt e 5.000.00mt foram usados para tirar a carta de condução, de  15.000.00 e 20.000.00mt para construção da sua casa. esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir outro credito para construção do murro de vedação.
texts.en:
He was born in the Namaacha district in the Maputo province.  He is 33-years-old, married, and completed six years of schooling but didn’t continue because there wasn’t enough money.  He has one daughter who is 12-years-old and who goes to school.  He lives in a rented house and maintains his brother who lives with him in his house.

He began to work in the Xisaka Hotel as a machine maintenance technician and was able to get his own house.  He has worked there for more than six years.  He earns 3,500 meticais (Mozambique currency) monthly which he uses for household expenses and construction costs.  In addition to work, in his free time he goes to the border with Swaziland where people are needed to transport cars that come from South Americ (cars from Dubai) to the capital, Maputo, earning 500 meticais per trip.

This is his fifth loan and it is in the amount of 25,000 meticais with which he intends to buy construction materials (cement, sand, door beams, and more) to continue working on his house project.  The previous loans of 3,500 and 5,000 meticais were used to get a driver’s license and those for 15,000 and 20,000 meticais were for construction work on his house.  He is confident that he will repay the loan before the set time and request another to build a fence.

loans.use: to buy building materials (cement, sand, door beams and more).

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Fallou est créé le 14 mai 2010, il est composé de vingt trois femmes qui sont unies par amitié et mènent comme activités principales le  petit commerce et la coiffure.


Madame Khayta la responsable est âgée de 47 ans, mariée elle est mère de cinq enfants; elle mène une activité de petit commerce et fait de la couture aussi. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite habillée en robe wax jaune.


Elle achéte ses produits ( chaussures,habits, parfums, pommades) dans la capitale et revend au niveau de son quartier et au marché.

Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son commerce afin de se faire un peu plus de revenus.



Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices renforcer son épargne et soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Fallou was created on May 14, 2010; it is composed of 23 women who are bound by friendship. They are mostly active in retail and hairdressing.

Mrs. Khayta, the group's leader, is 47 years old, married, and a mother of five. She manages a small retail business, and also does some sewing. She is standing to the right of the picture, dressed in a yellow dress of 'wax' fabric. She purchases her products (shoes, clothes, perfumes, lotions) in the capital city and resells them at the local level and at the market.

Her loan will make it possible for her to strengthen her trade to generate a slightly better income. With the profit, she wishes to increase her savings and to help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics intended for retail.

loans.name: Aslamkhon

texts.ru: Асламхон проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат. Имеет 7 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Асламхон предоставляет услугу. Он имеет точку, где под навесом он готовит и продает самбусу и пирожки. В этой области он более 5 лет. Кредит берет для расширения своей деятельности. Он хочет взять в аренду помещение, чтобы продолжать свою деятельность в холодное время суток, то есть зимой.
texts.en: Aslamkhon lives in Hamadoni. He is 50 years old, married, and has seven children. His wife is a housewife. Aslamhon provides a service. He has a place under a canopy where he makes and sells sambusas and pies. He has been doing this more than five years. He is taking out a loan to expand his business. He wants to lease a place so that he can continue working when it gets cold, during the winter.

loans.use: to expand his business by renting a shop

loans.name: Lebbo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 21 février 2001. Il est composé de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Siré Abdou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 71 ans. Elle est mariée sans enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge trois autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de poisson sec. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (nourriture etc.…)
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on February 21, 2001.  It is composed of eleven women who live in the same neighborhood.  They are principally engaged in small businesses.

Mrs.  Siré Abdou, at the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the leader of the group.  She is 71 years old.  She is married and has no children.  She cares for three children entrusted to her by their parents.

She keeps busy selling dried fish.  She has a lot of experience in this field, as she has been doing it for several years.

This loan will enable her to build up her capital and to develop her business.  The profits will aloow her to improve the family’s living conditions (food, etc.)

loans.use: To buy dried fish

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Maputo tem 42 anos de idade, é casada mãe de 3 filhos, todos vão a Escola. Fez a 6ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições, vive na casa própria com sua familia e sustenta duas sobrinhas que vivem com ela em sua casa.

Junta se com o seu marido e passa a viver no Distrito de Namaacha na Provincia do Maputo. Com ajuda do esposo constroi uma pequena loja na sua residência como forma de aumentar a renda familiar, vende produtos de primeira necessidade, tem como melhor produto o (sabão bingo, farinha de milho, feijão e arroz em kilos),faz uma receita diaria de 600.00 mt pois o negocio tende a baixar devido ao inverno, consegue poupar 1000.00mt por mês no xitique( colecta entre colegas do negocio) e a outra parte aplica nas dispesas da casa.

Este é o quinto empréstimo na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende aumentar o volume dos seus produtos. Os anteriores no valor de (10.000.00, 10.500.00, 15.000.00 e 15.000.00)mt foi para a mesma finalidade. está confiante que vai pagar antes do prazo estipulado. No futuro gostaria de melhorar as condições de sua loja e eventualmente abrir uma loja no mercado central, onde poderia vender mais ainda.
texts.en:
She was born in the Maputo province and is 42-years-old, married, and the mother of three children - all of whom go to school.  She completed six years of schooling but did not continue because of a lack of resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and maintains two nieces who live with her in her house.

Together with her husband she moved to the Namaacha district in Maputo province.  With his help, she built a small store in their house as a way to increase the family income.  She sells staple products like Bingo soap, cornmeal, beans, and rice by the kilo.  She makes daily sales of 600 meticais (Mozambique currency) though business tends to decrease in winter.  She manages to save 1000 meticais monthly in the “xitique” (a collective fund managed by members) and uses the rest for household expenses.

This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku and Kiva and is in the amount of 10,000 meticais.  She plans to use it to increase the amount of products she sells.  The previous loans in the amount of 10,000, 10,500, 15,000, and 15,000 meticais went for the same thing.  She is confident that she will make her payments before the stipulated timeframe.  In the future she would like to improve the conditions in her store and eventually open a store in the central market where she could sell even more.

loans.use: to buy and sell products.

loans.name: Abraham Brim's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Mile Ninety One, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. Their school was founded in 1974 to promote education to the children of Mile Ninety One and the surrounding villages. Currently, the school is staffed with 29 teachers and has an enrollment of 450 pupils. 

Abraham is a teacher at the school and is the leader of this group of borrowers. He is 50 years old and was born in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Abraham is married with six children and has been in the teaching profession for 25 years. He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials, including bags of cement, to complete the construction of his house. 

Staff from this institution, like many other institutions within SMT’s area of operation, come to SMT to apply for loans. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. Their institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment amount and paying SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to buy materials to complete his house construction

loans.name: Kadiamor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 21 février 2001.Il est  constitué de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou Ousmane qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge cinq autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle est détentrice d'une boutique villageois où elle vend divers produits tels: du riz, du sucre, du thé, des biscuits etc. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront  de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille (nourriture, santé, etc.…)
texts.en:
The solidarity group was created on February 12, 2001. It is composed of eleven women who all live in the same district. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Fatou Ousmane, who is on the right of the picture raising her hand, is the group's leader. She is 35 years old. She is married and a mother of four. She also takes care of five other children entrusted to her by their parents.

She is the owner of a local shop, where she sells various products such as rice, sugar, tea, cookies and such. She is quite experienced in this business, since she has been at it for several years.

This loan will allow her to increase her capital and to better develop her activities. The profit will make it possible for her to participate in the improvement of the family's living conditions (food, healthcare, etc.)

loans.use: buy products for her local food store.

loans.name: Rakhass Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 21 février 2001. Le groupe est  constitué de douze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Diénaba qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de sel. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (scolarité etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en: The RAKHASS solidarity group was created on February 21, 2001.  The group is composed of twelve women who live in the same neighborhood.  Their principal activities are small businesses.  Mrs. Diénaba, raising her hand at the right of the photo, is the leader of the group.  She is 48 years old, married and the mother of two children. She stays busy selling salt.  She has considerable experience in this business, having operated it for several years. This loan will enable her to bolster her capital and to further develop her business.  The profits will enable her to improve the family’s living conditions (education etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy salt.

loans.name: Christelle Rita Josianne

texts.fr:
Cliente de 41 ans, celibataire avec 1 enfant a sa charge, a la fin de ses etudes, detentrice d'un Certificat d'Aptitude Professionnelle, n'ayant pas encore un poste de travail, elle se lance dans la fabrication des sacs et pots de fleurs en fils tisses.Elle a des ventes regulieres de 10.000 a 25.000frs .

A l'octroi de son credit , elle va acheter des rouleaux de fils de differents couleurs, 10 rouleaux de fils bleu, 10 rouleaux de fils rouge, 10 rouleaux de fils vert. 

Pour le futur elle a l'intention d'ouvrir un atelier artisanal, ou elle va employer des jeunes filles meres, accroitre le nombre des sacs a fabriquer par jour.Elle compte beaucoup epargner pour faire face a ses projets d'elever son enfant et soutenir ses etudes.
texts.en:
Christelle, age 41, is unmarried and has one child to support. After completing her studies and obtaining a Vocational Training Certificate, but without job, she started manufacturing woven bags and flowerpots. Her regular sales range from XOF 10'000 to 25'000 (US$ 20 to 50).

With her loan, she will buy rolls of thread in various colors: blue, red and green (10 rolls of each).

In the future, she intends to open a handicraft workshop, where she will hire young single mother and increase the number of bags made each day. She intends to put a lot of money away to finance her projects, raise her child and support his studies.

loans.use: to buy rolls of thread in various colors, scissors, fabrics and accessories

loans.name: Jubboo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 21 février 2001. Le groupe est  composé de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit.

Madame Maimouna Babagale  qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de poisson sec et de néré. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille (scolarité etc.…)
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on February 21, 2011. The group is made up of eleven women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small-scale retail.

Mrs. Maimouna Babagale, right, with her hand raised, is the group's leader. She married and the mother of four children. She is also responsible for two other children entrusted to her by relatives. Maimouna sells dried fish and seeds from the locust tree. She has plenty of experience in this field, which she has been involved in for several years. This loan will allow her to increase her capital and strengthen her activity. The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (schooling, etc.).

loans.use: to buy dried fish and locust tree seeds.

loans.name: Ibonkerahon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 21 février 2001. Le groupe est  composé de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Souadou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est veuve sans enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge quatre autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de fruits et de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et d'augmenter son niveau d'épargne
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on 21 February 2001. The group comprises eleven women who live in the same area. Their main activity is running small retail businesses.

Ms. Souadou, on the right in the photo with the raised hand, is the group leader. She is 57 years old. She is widowed and has no children. She has four children in her care, all of whom were entrusted to her by their parents.

She runs a business selling fruits and vegetables. She has solid experience in this field, having practiced in it for several years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and better develop her business.

The profits will allow her to provide for herself and increase her level of savings.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Babacar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Babacar est créé le 14 mai 2010, il regroupe quinze femmes qui sont unies par des liens d'amitié, elles mènent diverses activités le petit commerce, l'artisanat et l'élevage.

Khady la responsable est âgée de 47 ans,mariée elle est mère de six enfants, elle mène une activité de petit commerce et a une expérience moyenne.Elle est debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo habillée en robe jaune bleu.

Elle s'approvisionne en habits, chaussures, poisson au marché central de la ville et revend sur place.

Son prêt lui servira d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de gagner beaucoup de revenus.

Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants et investir pour la construction d'une maison.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Babacar was created on 14 May 2010 and consists of fifteen women united by friendship. They are engaged in various activities such as small retail businesses, handicrafts, and livestock farming.

Khady, the group leader, is 47 years old, married, and has six children. She runs a small retail business and has gained some experience. She is standing all the way on the right in the photo, with the yellow and blue dress.

She gets her supplies of clothing, shoes, and fish at the central market in the city and re-sells them locally.

With her profit, she hopes to take care of her children's education and invest in building a house.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, and fish for resale.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 40 years old and has seven children. For the past three years, she has run a grocery store to earn a living. In addition, Sabina sells clothes to earn extra income. Her business has improved since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has completed training in business management skills. 

Sabina is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy vegetables to sell and to expand her store. In the future, she hopes to have a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and expand her store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 35 years old and a single mother of a 20-year-old child.  For three years, she has been operating a green grocery to earn a living.  Besides this, she is employed as a casual laborer for extra income and she also sells charcoal.  Mary works hard in her business so as to provide for her child. She hopes to expand her business in five years for more income generation.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy charcoal and second-hand clothes.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and second-hand clothes

loans.name: Idrissa A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from a primary school in Mile-Ninety-One, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 5,000,000; with the help of this loan, some of these teachers will invest in their businesses, others will pay school fees for their children, etc. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for repaying SMT on their behalf. 

Idrissa is a teacher at the school and the leader of this group. The 35-year-old has been in the teaching profession for many years now. A native of a village called Kambrabia Yoni, Idrissa is married and has 3 children. Idrissa has requested a loan of SLL 1,200,000 in order to buy materials for building house - cement and iron-corrugated zinc - for the completion of a project that is underway.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a house

loans.name: Gisele Annie Florence

texts.fr:
Cliente de 47 ans , mariee et mere de 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 10 et 25 ans. Ayant arrete ses etudes en classe de terminal il ya de cela 18 ans, vu sa charge elle ouvre un atelier de couture pour faire des series de draps.Elle confectionne des camisoles des draps a domicile et elle a une forte clientele, ses revenus  sont de 10.000 a 35.000 frs par jour.

A l'octroi de son pret ,elle compte renforcer le stock des pagnes des tissus, des rouleaux de popeline de differents couleurs,rouleaux de coton satine fleuris, de la dentelle,des pagnes de differents motifs  des lots  fils a coudre, de la vegeline, des fils a coudre.

Tres ambitieuse, elle a des commandes des camisoles et des  draps qu'elle coud , et ses meilleures clientes sont des femmes  et elle fait  aussi des livraisons des  tenues des femmes et camisoles  dans des boutiques de la place .
texts.en:
