Gisèle, age 47, is married and the mother of 5 children, age 10 to 25. Having interrupted her studies at 12th grade level 18 years ago, she opened a sewing workshop to makes series of sheets. She makes camisoles and sheets at her home, and has a strong customer base. Her daily revenues range from XOF 10'000 to 35'000 (ca US$ 20 to 70).

With her new loan, she intends to bolster her stock of pagnes (colorful African cloth), fabrics, poplins in various colors, flowery satin cotton rolls, lace, pagnes with various motifs, and bundles of sewing thread.

Very ambitious, she gets orders for camisoles and sheets that she sews. Her best customers are women, and she also delivers women's outfits and camisoles to the boutiques in town.

loans.use: to buy cotton fabric, satin cotton rolls, lace, thread, etc

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 29-year-old married lady with three children. Recently, she has started a small home business making handmade accessories such as necklaces, bracelets and other pieces. In order to keep up with the latest fashion, she keeps on looking for new ideas that will catch her customers' eyes. 

Maha has applied for this loan to buy more tools and materials such as gemstones to add a new collection to her accessories. Because Maha is a conservative person, her brother-in-law’s wife, Kefah, is in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: to buy more materials, such as gemstones, to make accessories.

loans.name: Duy

texts.en: Duy, 34, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. He is married and has 2 sons. His wife helps him run a frame-making business. He has been involved in this activity for 6 years. Duy has requested a loan to buy better quality machines to assist him in making frames and increasing production. The loan will also allow him to employ an additional worker and scale-up the size of his business. He hopes that the loan will enable him to increase his income and improve the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy better quality machines for his frame-making business

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is 39 years old. He is a hardworking and determined businessman who is always working to succeed. He is married and blessed with three children, of whom two are in school. Andrew earns his income by making pans using scrap metals. His association with Kiva's partner, Faulu Kenya, has enabled him to benefit by getting business ideas and accessing financial resources. He hopes in the next five years to reach a wider market. His dream is to be self reliant and independent. Andrew is requesting a loan of 90,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a welding machine and scrap metal.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine and scrap metal

loans.name: Wellington

texts.en: Wellington has operated his cereal store in Naivasha for the last two years. He buys cereals in bulk directly from farmers and then sells them at the local market. He is 48 years old, married to Susan and they have two school-aged children. He was introduced to Kiva's partner, KADET, by one of KADET's field officers and this will be his third loan. He repaid all of his previous loans on time. Wellington plans to use the requested loan to buy more bags of maize and beans to sell in his store. In the future, Wellington hopes to grow his business and become a large supplier of cereals in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and beans for sale

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Thao is 38 years old and married. She has 3 children, 1 son and 2 daughters. Her husband is a tailor and they live in Ho Chi Minh City. Thao supports her family by making school bags. She has been engaged in this activity for over 11 years. She intends to borrow money to buy additional cloth and other materials to enabL. her to increase production and generate more income. She hopes that with the requested loan and with her effort she can give her family a better future.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other materials to make bags

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard has operated his tailor shop in Naivasha for the last six years. He makes new clothes while also repairing torn ones. He is 35 years old, married to Esther and they have two children. He was introduced to Kiva's partner, KADET, by a field officer and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of KES 25,000, which he used to boost his business, in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy more fabric for making new clothes for sale. In the future, Bernard hopes to open a bigger tailor shop and have many clothes for display and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for making new clothes

loans.name: Akutwala Ekiro Bulenga Group

texts.en:
The nice shoes this 38-year-old mother of 5 has been selling for the past 8 years, plus her warm good-natured disposition is what has endeared Scovia to most of her old and new clients alike. She set forth in this business with pep talk and moral and financial support from close relatives. Prior to that, Scovia was involved in a restaurant business. She has built on her experience over the past 8 years. She rationalizes that the only key to success in any business is diligence. 

On the side, she earns more profits from her farming business. She grows crops such as bananas, beans and cassava which are staple foods in most parts of Mpigi. The supplementary farming business has been pivotal too in her quest to extricate herself out of narrow circumstances. Weekly her sales revenue totals up to 100,000 Ugandan shillings. The requested loan will assist her in the purchase of more pairs of shoes to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more pairs of shoes to sell

loans.name: Surumpen

texts.en: Surumpen, 58, is married to Tonuo and they are blessed with ten children. She has been trading livestock for three years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 30,000. This is her third loan from Kiva's partner, KADET LTD, and she has a good credit history. She will use the loan funds to buy goats for sale. Her hopes are to export the livestock to neighboring countries in the future.

loans.use: To buy goats for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth has practiced farming in a town called Ndunyu Njeru for the last 21 years. She is 54 years old and a single mother of one child. She was introduced to Kiva's partner, KADET, by a field officer and this will be her second loan. She repaid her previous loan of KES 40,000 in good time. Elizabeth plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to hire fieldworkers

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is a hardworking 34-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children. Two of his children are in school. Joram works as a tailor and supplements his income by renting out houses. His association with Faulu Kenya has enabled him to improve his business. 

Joram is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to buy a sewing machine. Within the next five years, he hopes to grow and expand his business so that he is able to realize his dream of employing other people.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and livestock

loans.name: Parsokote

texts.en:
Parsokote is 33 years old. He is married and has three children who are attending school. For the past three years, Parsokote has been a farmer. His farm produces wheat and maize that he sells through middlemen. 

Parsokote is requesting his first loan through KADET to cultivate maize. He will use the extra income from his loan to help pay school fees for his children and improve his family’s standard of living. Parsokote’s major business challenges have been unpredictable weather conditions and the pests and diseases that affect his production. 

In the future, Parsokote plans to acquire more acres of land to expand his farm.

loans.use: to grow corn

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 39 years old and has four daughters. Thu earns an income to support her family by running a general store. Her husband is a driver. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thu would like to take a loan to expand her shop by purchasing more products such as confectioneries, snacks and beverages to satisfy her customers.

Thu hopes that through the loan, she will be abL. to generate additional income to provide a secure future for her family and send all her daughters to school.

loans.use: to pay for stock such as confectioneries for her general store.

loans.name: Naramani

texts.en:
Naramani is 62 years old and is a widow with five children. She is from the village of Naisi-Narok, Kenya. To make a living, Naramani practices mixed farming and she has been farming for over ten years. 

Naramani is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her farm. She is has been a good client and this will be her third loan. Naramani hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
El Sr. Claudio de 30 años de edad, esta acompañado con la Sra. Lorenza de 26 años de edad, ellos aun no conocen la dicha de tener hijos.
Don Claudio es mecánico hace mas de 11 años, aproximadamente desde el año: 2000; el trabajó mucho tiempo como secretario en un taller mecánico, donde fue aprendiendo este oficio, y a la ves juntando su dinero para poder comprar herramientas y así habilitar para su propio local, en la actualidad tiene muchos clientes gracias al buen servicio que ofrece.
El tiene como principal objetivo el de construir un tinglado para ofrecerle todas las comodidades a sus clientes.
El invertiria este crédito en comprar más herramientas, teniendo en cuenta que varias personas trabajan para el.
texts.en:
Claudio is 30 years old and lives with 26 year-old Lorenza.  They have yet to experience the joy of having children.

Claudio has been a mechanic for more than 11 years; since approximately 2000.  He worked for a long time as a secretary in a garage where he learned the trade.  He also put together some money so that he could buy tools and set up his own premises.  He currently has a lot of customers thanks to the good service that he provides.

Claudio's main goal is to build a shed so that he can offer his customers all possible comforts.

Claudio will invest this loan in buying tools, bearing in mind that he has several people working for him.

loans.use: to buy tools for repairing cars

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUGNON est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Afiavi Georgette est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Afiavi Georgette est âgée de 51 ans et est mariée à un certain Salomon. Le couple a six enfants à charge, dont quatre sont les leurs. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Afiavi Georgette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a environs vingt ans que Afiavi Georgette exerce comme activité, la vente de bois de chauffage à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Afiavi Georgette vend de l'"akassa" (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) et des poissons frits à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins. Afiavi Georgette s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Afiavi Georgette désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Afiavi Georgette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Mahougnon group comprises three people who live together in the same area. The group representative, Afiavi Georgette, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the third time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ with the goal of raising the level of their business. Afiavi Georgette is 51 years old and married to a man named Salomon. The couple have six children in their care, of whom four are their own. All of the children are in school and live together with their parents. Afiavi Georgette did not attend school. For about twenty years, she has run a business selling firewood at her home. In addition, she sells "akassa" (a local food made from cornstarch) and fried fish at her home; this allows her to respond without too much difficulty to the needs of her family and to provide for herself. She gets her supplies in Benin. With the goal of better responding to the demands of her clientele, Afiavi Georgette wants to increase her stock of products. To do this she, along with the other Mahougnon group members, is seeking a third loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a hardworking 38-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with two children, ages 7 and 6 years old. He makes his income by using his motorbike for a transport business. Previously, he was an employee. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for supporting him financially. In the next five years, he wants to own a van for a transport business. His dream is to be financially stable.

Patrick is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy another motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilzer.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira is married with children. She owns a business in the central market of Gafurov region where she sells fabrics for sewing national women's dresses. Shoira has been in this trade for about eight years. Her business has seen considerable growth since she modernized her vending facility using loans from IMON International. Shoira has been partnering with our organization for about eight years. Shoira is requesting a loan of 13,000 TJS to increase her assortment of inventory and boost her sales. She is ready to continue working hard to see her business grow and thrive. Her ultimate goal is to provide a better life for her family. She also plans to invest part of her profit in doing some basic remodeling of her apartment. She did not have any problems with previous loan repayments. We hope the current loan will also be repaid without any delinquencies, and we are excited to promote the further expansion of Shoira's enterprise. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert grows wheat and is also a livestock trader. He lives with his wife and their one child. He is seeking a loan which he will use to buy farm inputs and more livestock. His goal is to work hard to support his family and, above all, to help his children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and add more livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy laboratory chemicals.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, age 28, is married to Gladys and they are blessed with three children, ages 10, 7 and 4 years old. He does livestock trading and has been in operation for 14 years. The business earns him a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings. This is his second loan with KADET Ltd, and he repaid the previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to buy goats and cows for sale. John hopes to educate his children and build his own home in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows and goats for sale.

loans.name: Aimee Blanche

texts.fr:
Cliente de 34 ans, mariee et mere de 4 enfants.a l'arret de ses etudes en classe de troisieme par manque de soutien , elle se lance dans la vente des beignets  pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
Tous les matins, elle se leve tot et commence a cuire ses beignets,elle a une forte clientele et ses ventes sont de 20.000 a 25.000 frs par jour.
Avec le pret qu'elle compte recevoir, elle va acheter 2 sacs de farine de 50kg, 50kg de sucre, 50l d'huile, de la levure chimique,du sucre vanille et du bois de chauffe.

Avec les benefices de ses ventes , elle pense a beaucoup epargner pour qu'a l'avenir elle  construise un local confortable  pour etre a l'abri du soleil et de la pluie.Tres connue dans le quartier on l'appelle (Mama Mikate)la maman des beignets.
texts.en: She is a 34-year-old client, married mother of 4 children. Lacking of support, she left her study after finishing middle school and started selling doughnut to support her family. Every morning, she gets up early and starts baking. She has a lot of clients and makes between 20000 and 25000 francs a day. With this loan that she hopes to get, she will buy 2 50Kg bags of flour, 50Kg of sugar, 50cl of oil, baking powder, vanilla sugar and wood. With the profit of the sales, she thinks to save a lot to build a comfortable work space to not be exposed to the sun and the rain in the future. She is very well-known in the area and people call her "Mama Mikate", the doughnut mom.

loans.use: to by two 50Kg bags of flour, 50Kg of sugar, 50cl of oil, baking powder, vanilla sugar and wood

loans.name: Tolib

texts.en: Tolib is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children. Tolib is an animal farmer He owns cows and sells their milk with the help of his wife and elder son. In order to further develop his business, Tolib wants to take out a loan and buy six more cows and feed for them. After fattening them up, he will be able to sell them for a more favorable price. Then Tolib will be able to use the profit from his business for the well-being of his family. ====================================== More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for developing his business.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is 38 years old. She is married and has one daughter. Her husband is an electrician. She lives with her husband and daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Mai has been running her general store since 2006. She sells a small range of goods such as snack foods and confectionery to people in the local community. Mai is requesting a loan to enable her to stock her general store with a wider range of basic goods. She hopes that this will assist her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract new customers.

Mai hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate a higher income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy a wider range of basic goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 23 years old and single. He resides in Narok, Kenya. Samson is a maize farmer. He has been doing this for the past two years. He knew KADET through a registered client with KADET.

Samson has been a good client and this is his second loan. He plans to use the loan to prepare land for farming and to buy farm inputs.

Samson hopes to make profit and use it to re-invest in other business. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en:
A 59-year-old businesswoman, Kaninishe is a widow with six grown children. For the past 10 years she has been running a hair beauty shop as her primary business and a retail shop as a secondary business, earning a monthly income of KES 13,800 which she uses to meet family needs.

An existing KADET customer introduced Kaninishe to KADET, and she is now applying for her first loan with which she will buy beauty products such as shampoo and a blow-dryer, and add a stock of sugar, rice, maize meal to her shop.

With the anticipated additional profits arising from the loan, she will educate her children to university level. Kaninishe's hope is to purchase land and build rental houses to generate additional income.

loans.use: to purchase products for her two businesses.

loans.name: Alogo Group

texts.fr: ALOGO est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Antoinette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un militaire du nom de Pascal. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Antoinette et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Antoinette a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a près de quinze ans que Antoinette vend du maïs et du charbon de bois à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité qui lui permet d'assurer ses besoins et de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Antoinette vend également des condiments de sauce à son domicile. Antoinette s’approvisionne dans le Nord du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Antoinette sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe ALOGO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: The Alogo group comprises four people, all of whom live in the same area in Benin. The group representative, Antoinette (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 35 years old and married to a serviceman named Pascal. The couple have four children, all in school and in the care of their parents. Antoinette and her husband live together with their children. Antoinette ended her studies in secondary school. For close to fifteen years, she has sold maize and charcoal at her home. Alongside this activity, which allows her to provide for herself and for her children, Antoinette also sells sauce condiments at her home. She gets her supplies in North Benin. With the goal of satisfying her customers, Antoinette is seeking a loan along with the other Alogo group members. This loan will allow her to better respond to the demands of her clientele and generate more profits.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and maize.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher is a focused, hard-working taxi driver from Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He is from a family of taxi drivers. Alisher started driving a taxi about seven years ago. He is respected among his fellow taxi drivers. Alisher is married and has two children. He has requested a loan to help cover the purchase and registration costs of a new taxi vehicle he recently bought. This new vehicle is an upgrade over his previous car and is the type of vehicle passengers prefer for long-distance trips. This loan will help Alisher continue to offer high quality transportation services around his city.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to help cover the purchase and registration costs of a new taxi

loans.name: Maria Liz

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Liz vive en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
Ella es comerciante hace más de tres años, la misma tiene una despensa bien surtida. Comenta que le costó bastante obtener su propio negocio ya que había viajado al exterior para hacerse un poco de capital porque el sustento del día a día es muy pesado, mas aun teniendo un hijo a quien criar. Ella es soltera con un Hijo llamado Ale de 5 años, y es el motivo por el cual su lucha se hace más liviana.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y demás para el abastecimiento de su local, sabe que si tiene mayor variedad de productos, podrá atraer a mas clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la ayuda que le brida.
texts.en:
Maria Liz lives in the city of Coronel Oviedo.  She has been a saleswoman for three years and has a well-stocked grocery store.  She comments that it cost her quite a bit to obtain her own business.  She traveled abroad to make a little capital because supporting yourself day by day is very hard, even more so when you have a child to support.

Maria Liz is single and has a 5 year-old son called Ale who makes all her hard work feel that bit lighter.  She is requesting a loan to buy food products, drinks, dairy products, etc. to stock her store.  She knows that if she has a larger variety of products, she will be able to attract more customers.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the help that they give her.

loans.use: to buy drinks, food products and dairy products to stock her store

loans.name: Gelou Blood Marina

texts.fr:
Cliente de 29 ans, celibataire sans enfant , A la fin de l'obtention de son Diplome de Technicien Superieur,n'ayant pas pu trouver du travail elle se lance dans l'apprentissage de la broderie et le tricotage il depuis bientot dix ans.Elle fait des tricots et brassieres pour nouveaux nes, des napperons et sacs en fils de nylon.
Elle fait des ventes de 50.000 a 125.000 frs par jour, elle a une forte clientele qui sont la majorite des femmes enceintes et des femmes au foyer.
A l'octroi de son pret, elle va renforcer le stock de ses fils en achetant 10 douzaine de fils a tricoter, 10 rouleaux de fils en nylon et des tissus.
Avec ses benefices , elle est entrain d'epargner pour acheter une machine a tricoter pour fabriquer des ensembles de nouveaux nes en quantite enormes et des series de services de table.
texts.en:
This borrower is 29 years old and single without children. Unable to find work after obtaining her Senior Technician Diploma, she started to learn embroidery and knitting nearly ten years ago. She makes knit tops and wrap-overs for newborns, as well as placemats and nylon bags. 

She earns 50,000 to 125,000 francs per day, and has a strong customer base consisting mostly of pregnant women and housewives. 

With her loan, she will replenish her stock of supplies by buying 10 dozen balls of yarn, 10 rolls of nylon thread and some fabrics.  

With her profits, she will add to her savings to purchase a knitting machine, which will help her to produce large quantities of clothing for newborn and sets of table linens.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozens balls of yarn, 10 rolls of nylon thread, and some fabrics

loans.name: Odil

texts.en:
Odil is 47 years old. He is married with two children. Odil sells dried fruit in the central local market. He has been in this business for 15 years. The dried fruit are very popular in Tajikistan. Every hostess has dried fruit in store for serving in case there are guests in the house. Moreover, the dried fruit is as a rule served during all the family occasions like wedding parties, birthday parties and others. Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, Odil's business is quite successful and brings a stable income for the family. Today, Odil requests $3,000 USD to purchase dried fruit with the purpose of increasing his range of goods to sell.

These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase dried fruit

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 16 years.  He is 46 years old and married to Veronicah. They have four school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor.  He will sell his produce at the local market.

In the future, Cyrus hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 32 years old. He is married and they have three children. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past five years. He has applied for his second loan with KADET Ltd to purchase farm supplies, such as seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more animals. He has been a good client. He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farm. His dreams are to prosper in farming and be able to provide better lives for his children.

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is a 55-year-old hardworking woman. Since her husband retired, Huda opened her own food market in the neighborhood and has been successfully running it for three years now. From her profit, she was able to include selling sandwiches and other types of food products, to the item sold in the store. Now Huda is applying for this loan to expand the store area and open another food market in another area in the future.

loans.use: to expand the food market space.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a hair drier and cosmetics

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  She does small-scale farming and sells her produce at the local market.  She is 46 years old and married to David.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan.  She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Mary hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mushina

texts.en:
Mushina is a 55-year-old married woman. She has 10 children who depend on her. She has been a farmer for a period of 15 years.

She learned about KADET through other women registered in her area of residence. She paid the previous loan successfully without any tricky situations. This is her second loan from KADET LTD and she wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer.

She hopes to expand her farming and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Haknazar

texts.en: Haknazar sells plates and dishes of the oriental style. These goods are in popular demand among the population. This kind of china is widely used for the dowry of girls and also for family celebrities. For almost 10 years, Haknazar has been working as a market vendor. Haknazar is planning to enlarge his range of goods and to purchase china for enlarging his inventory. For this purpose, he requests a loan of $3000 US. Haknazar is 59 years old. He is married and has three adult children. The love of his grandchildren is the biggest reason for Haknazar to make an effort to provide what they need. Haknazar and his family are sincerely grateful for your support. ====================================== More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase plates and dishes of the oriental style in order to increase his range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is a 43-year-old married woman. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with two children and her husband. Her husband is a bricklayer. 

Thanh has owned a clothing store that sells trousers, shirts and dresses for women for nearly 10 years. She would like to take a loan to expand her business by buying a greater range of clothing to sell to her customers in the local community. 

She hopes that with a greater range of products, she will be abL. to attract more customers to her store and earn more money to cover her family's living expenses.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell in her store

loans.name: Vivogbe Group

texts.fr: VIVOGBE est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres sont issues de la même famille. La présidente du groupe, Afiavi Félicité (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Félicien. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés.  Afiavi Félicité et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs cinq enfants. Afiavi Félicité n'a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Il y a dix huit ans environs que Afiavi Félicité fait le commerce de produits vivriers à son domicile. Afiavi Félicité s’approvisionne au Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Afiavi Félicité sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit avec les membres du groupe VIVOGBE. Ce crédit lui servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: The Vivogbe group comprises four people, all of whom come from the same family. The group president, Afiavi Félicité (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 40 years old and married to a carpenter named Félicien. The couple have five children, some of whom are in school. Afiavi Félicité and her husband live together with their five children. Afiavi Félicité only attended primary school. For about 18 years, she has sold food items at her home. She gets her supplies in Benin. This business allows her to provide for herself and her children. With the goal of satisfying her clientele, Afiavi Félicité is seeking a loan for the second time along with the other Vivogbe group members. This loan will serve to increase her stock of products and generate more profits.

loans.use: To buy various food items (beans, maize, manioc flour).

loans.name: Shoayub

texts.en:
Shoayub is dedicated to the production of onion, grapes, watermelons and melons. With a lot of effort and sacrifice, he carries out this work every day for the purpose of improving the conditions of his family, bringing the daily bread to his table and, at the same time, saving for the improvement of his dwelling. His dwelling needs a lot of help because it is in a bad state, which little by little he has come to improve. Shoayub is married with one child. His family admires him for the fact that his multiple efforts have permitted him to bring food to his home and that in addition, he has managed to keep his children in school. The need that this gentleman faces is to invest in his business through the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. By this, he hopes that Kiva will offer him the loan to do well along with his family. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 39-year-old business lady. She is married to Samuel who is a primary school teacher. They are blessed with four children ages 14, 12, 4 and 3, respectively. She has been running a retail shop for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Mary will use the loan to add a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal to the shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her shop. Her hope is to have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add sugar, rice and maize flour to her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase stock of secondhand clothes for her business.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en: Umedjon is married and has two children. He's been working as a taxi driver for four years. Umedjon would like a loan of 9,000 somoni to help purchase spare parts for his vehicle. He likes being independent and is a real go-getter. Umedjon wanted to start his own business and he achieved his goal. Now, as he sets new goals for the future, he is hoping that additional financial assistance will help him grow business-wise and become self-sustainable and successful. ====================================== More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for thorough fixing of his car.

loans.name: Parsalunye

texts.en:
Parsalunye is 33 years old and married with three children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last 10 years.

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his abode. This is his third loan with which he has planned to purchase farm inputs, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. He intends to use the return from the loan to plow back into farming and in part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to higher levels of education.

He an industrious man who struggles to achieve without funding.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, aged 30, is married to Carolyne, and they are blessed with one child. He operates a hardware shop, which has been in operation for seven years. The business earns him a monthly income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is his fourth loan term with KADET LTD., and he has successfully managed to repay the previous loans. He will use the funds to buy more hardware items for his shop. Charles intends to use the expected profits to build rental houses on his piece of land and to educate his child. He hopes to have a bigger hardware shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy hardware for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. She does small-scale farming and sells her produce at the local market. She is 43 years old and married to Mwangi. They have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of her friends, and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Mary hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Sr. Alfredo es de la ciudad de Santaní. El se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos de consumo como ser huevos de gallina, aceite y panificados por casi toda la zona del Departamento de San Pedro.
El se define como un hombre muy trabajador y luchador. Día a día se levanta a tempranas horas para poder ir al mercado a abastecerse de productos y luego procede a la venta de los mismos. Cuenta que su trabajo implica mucho tiempo y es un poco agotador.
El solicita el credito para la compra de de huevos de gallina, aceite y panificados para poder seguir abastecido de productos.
texts.en:
Alfredo is from the city of Santaní.  His business is buying and selling items such as hen's eggs, oil and baked goods.  He sells these products throughout nearly all of San Pedro department.

Alfredo describes himself as a very hard-working and tenacious man.  He gets up early every day in order to go to the market and stock up with products.  He then goes out and sells them.  He tells us that his job takes a lot of time and is quite exhausting.

Alfredo is requesting this loan to buy hen's eggs, oil and baked goods so that he can continue stocking his business with products.

loans.use: to buy hen's eggs, oil and baked goods

loans.name: Mutangu

texts.en:
Mutangu, aged 37, is married to Josephine, and they are blessed with six children. He runs a grocery stall, which has been in operation for four years. The business earns him a monthly income of 2,300 Kenyan shillings.

This is his third loan term with KADET LTD, and he has repaid the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan funds to buy groceries for resale. Mutangu intends to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and hopes to save for the future.

loans.use: To buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a determined and hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with two children.  He uses his motorbike for his transport business to earn a living for his family. Thanks to Faulu Kenya for supporting him financially, he was able to buy a motorbike. He hopes to own a van for his transport business in the future. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to repair his motorcycle.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar is a widow with one child. She runs a small business in the central city market selling kid’s clothing. Her vending spot is well known for her wide variety of inventory. The assorted clothing items Dilbar offers for sale in her kiosk are in high demand among her customers. Dilbar has been in this trade for 10 years. Dilbar’s hard work, plain and simple, is the engine that drives her success. She is very consistent in her business planning. Now she is requesting a loan of 9,500 Somoni to increase her assorted merchandise in a recently opened vending location and to expand her trade. One of Dilbar’s long-term plans is to launch her own start-up manufacturing and selling clothing and increase her stock turnover as a result. 
  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 12 years. She does small-scale farming and sells her produce at the local market.  She is 49 years old, married to Paul and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Alice hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  He is 44 years old, married to Mirriam and they have five school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow to boost his farming income.

In the future, Antony hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  He is 54 years old and married to Anne. They have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be his fourth loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. He normally sells his produce at the local market.

In the future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tusiampei

texts.en:
Tusiampei is 50 years old and a married woman. She has nine children who depend on her. She has been a farmer for a period of 16 years.

She knew about KADET through other women registered in her area of residence. She paid the previous loan successfully without complication; this is her second loan from KADET LTD. She wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, age 43, is married to Dorothy. They are blessed with three children aged between 13 and 20 years. He does livestock trading, which he has been doing for four years. The business earns him a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the loan funds to buy chicken and sheep for resale. Paul intends to use the anticipated profits to start dairy farming and hopes to own a butchery in future.

loans.use: To buy chicken and sheep.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old business lady. She is married to Kenneth, who is a businessman. They are blessed with one child aged 4 years. She has been running a hair salon as a primary business and a boutique as a secondary business for the past 11 years with the monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family members.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mary will use the loan to buy beauty products like blow dryers and shampoo and will use the rest to add stock of new clothes to her boutique. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, she will expand the salon and employ some workers. Her hopes and dreams are to own many hair salons in different sites, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy beauty products like blow dryers and shampoo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a kiosk

loans.name: Tanios

texts.en: Tanios is a 32-year-old Lebanese single man living on his own. He has been working as a home electrician for the past 10 years. He works on a freelance basis, serving clients wherever they are located. With his requested loan of $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will invest in purchasing the new tools he needs. He has recently stuck with multiple electric projects and has to be prepared to satisfy the clients well. He feels positive about the future of his business and looks forward to working on bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase new tools

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 50-year-old business lady. She is married with two children who are 12 and 5 years old. She has been cooking and selling beans and maize for the past 11 years, with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family members. 
  
She is applying for her first loan from KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Emily will use the loan to add to her stock of dry maize and beans. 

With the anticipated profit from her business, she will educate her children up to university level. Her hope is to open a hotel, which will help her with her children’s education.

loans.use: To add to her stock of dry maize and beans

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru: Точинисо проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст, 37 лет. Она замужем, имеет троих детей. У нее среднее образование. Уже два года как она занимается торговлей. У себя дома она открыла магазин хозяйственных товаров. Она берет кредит для приобретения новых видов тарелок, чайников и бокалов. То есть она хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара, чтобы привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en: Tojiniso lives in Yavan. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She has a secondary education. She has worked in trade for two years. She opened a shop in her home selling household goods.  She is taking out a loan to buy new kinds of plates, teapots and glasses. She wants to increase the variety of goods she offers to attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of plates, teapots and glasses

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is a 53-year-old married man. He lives with two children and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife is a teacher. 

Dan earns an income to support his family by selling soft drinks in front of his house. He has done this for the past 10 years. He intends to take a loan to buy a greater range of beverages to increase his income.

He hopes that his business will go well and provide him with enough income to repair his home.

loans.use: to buy more beverages to sell

loans.name: Carmen Antonia

texts.es:
La Sra carmen vive en la ciudad de Santani. Ella tiene una despensa con lo cual puede mantenerse y solventar sus gastos personales y de la canasta familiar.
Ella trabaja desde muy tempranas horas todos los días, ya que su negocio implica que empiece desde temprano y termine a altas horas de la noche. Ella sueña con algún día poder agrandar su negocio con lo cual podrá tener mas productos en exhibición.
Ella solicita en credito para la compra de azúcar, comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas y demás. Ella tiene las esperanzas puestas en el credito ya que le sera de muchísima ayuda.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in the city of Santani.  She has a general store that she supports herself with and is able to cover personal expenses and provide her home with basic items.

She works every day starting very early because her business implies an early start and an end very late at night.  She dreams with someday being able to enlarge the business to have more products on display.

She requested the loan to buy sugar, foodstuffs, beverages, vegetables and others.  She has high hopes placed on the loan which will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Masinambane Group

texts.en:
Thembisile is 53 years old and married with nine children between 22 and 32 years old. She also takes care of two relatives in her home in Mandini, South Africa. Over the last three years, she has been in business raising chickens and selling them from her home. She requested a loan through WDB and Kiva to purchase more chickens to increase her stock.

Over the next five years, Thembisile hopes to expand her stock to include general items like food and clothes. She says that the biggest problem her business faces is that her customers buy on credit and fail to repay her. She would like to thank Kiva and WDB for helping her a lot. The money she makes from her chickens will help to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to sell

loans.name: Judith Clairemonde

texts.fr:
Cliente agee de 40 ans, divorcee et mere de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 7 et 22 ans. N'ayant pas de soutien pour poursuivre ses etudes ,elle se lance dans le commerce en vendant du foufou ou farine de tubercule de manioc depuis 1997.Elle ecrase ces ecosses de foufou dans un moulin, qu'elle transforme en farine de foufou, c'est l'aliment de base ici au Congo , ses recettes sont considerables , car elle encaisse en moyenne 150.000 par semaine.

A l'octroi de son pret , elle va renforcer le stock de sa marchandise en achetant 10 sacs de farine de tubercule (foufou)car, elle a une forte demande.

Elle envisage beaucoup epargner dans le but de voyager a l'interieur du pays pour acheter les tubercules, et de devenir grossiste et a la longue ouvrir un depot de foufou.Elle prend soin de ses enfants , supporte leur scolarite et entreprend des relations de bon voisinage.
texts.en:
A 40-year old client, divorced and the mother of three  children ranging between seven and 22 years of age. Lacking financial support for continuing her education, in 1997 she launched into  selling “foufou,” or manioc flour. She  mills peeled manioc yams and transforms them into    "foufou," which is a staple food here in Congo. She has significant income as her daily receipts average 150,000 francs.

Thanks to her loan, she will bolster her stock by buying 10 bags of “foufou” as she is facing high demand. She plans to keep saving money in order to travel to the interior of the country in order to buy yams so as to become a wholesaler and eventually to open a “foufou” warehouse. She supports her children, pays for their education and maintains good relations within her community.

loans.use: to buy ten 50-kg bags of "foufou" [yam flour]

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is 32 years old. He is a hardworking and honest businessman. He is married and a proud father of one child. He has been selling shoes for the last eight years to earn a living for his family.  He has retained his business because he has been trained in business management by Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to grow his business in five years to generate more income. He wants a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more used shoes.

loans.use: To buy used shoes to sell

loans.name: Bulenga Twekembe Group A

texts.en:
40-year-old Flavia plies her food sales business in the many food markets in Mpigi. It is now a decade in this trade for this happily married mother of six. Before taking root in this business, Flavia was engaged in a retail trade. She dispensed with it in time. The last 10 years have been years of mixed fortunes in her business transactions but she says the successes outweigh the failures. That, in many respects, explains why she is still in this business. She has managed to shoulder most of her family related responsibilities with earnings from this business. 

Flavia principally sells bananas, maize, beans and cassava. Monthly this business generates her sales profits totaling up to 800,000 Shillings. She intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more foods such as rice, cabbages, pineapples, maize, etc to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more foods such as rice, cabbages, pineapples, maize, etc to resell.

loans.name: Peninaa

texts.en: Peninaa is a determined 33-year-old lady. She is married and blessed with five children. She has been operating a restaurant for the last year to be able to provide for her family. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has acquired skills in financial management. This has helped her to improve her business.  She hopes to open other outlets of her business in five years. Her dream is to venture into other businesses. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sodas and beer and open another branch of her business.

loans.use: To buy sodas and beer and open another branch of her business

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Hector es dueño de una despensa ubicada en la ciudad de Santani. Por medio de este trabajo el ha podido solventar aquellos gastos que implica la manutencion de un hogar y de su negocio mismo.
El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora. Comenta que tener una despensa es un trabajo muy sacrificado, puesto que requiere no solo una gran invesion monetaria, sino tambien mucho esfuerzo fisico. Entre sus aspiraciones esta poder agrandar su negocio para ofrecer mas comodidades a sus clientes.
El solicita el credito para el abastecimiento de su local, por medio de la compra de comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas y demas. El esta muy esperanzado en el credito ya que le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Héctor owns a general store located in the city of Santani.  This business makes it possible for him to meet household and personal expenses.  

He defines himself as a very hard working, tenacious person.  He comments that having a store is a very demanding job because it not only requires a significant financial investment but also much physical work.  Among his hopes is being able to enlarge the business to offer more comfort to his customers.

He is asking for the loan to stock his store through the purchase of foodstuffs, beverages, vegetables and others.  He has placed high hopes on the loan that will be of great help to him.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Dieudonne

texts.fr:
Client age de 45 ans, marie et pere de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 11 mois et 22 ans.Par manque de soutien pour faire des etudes  secondaires et universitaires, il se lance dans la fabrication et  commercialisation des gateaux.Ses recettes font en moyenne 20.000fr par jour.

Vue la forte demande sur le marche , l'octroi du pret permettre de renforcer le stock de 2 sacs de 50 kg  farine, 50kg de sucre, 25l de bidon d'huile , 10kg de margarine, palettes des oeufs, de la levure et levure chimique.
Il a l'intention de beaucoup epargner a partir des benefices afin de construire une patisserie de grande surface, tres entreprenant , il fait face a la scolarite de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This customer is 45 years old, married and a father of four kids aged 11 months to 22 years old. Because of a lack of support to pursue high-school and college-level education, he started baking and selling pastry. His daily sales average 20,000 XAF.
Given the market's strong demand, granting the loan will allow him to strengthen his stock with two 50-kilo bags of flour, 50 kilos of sugar, a 25-liter jerrycan of cooking oil, 10 kilos of margarine, egg cartons, yeast and baking powder.
He plans on saving a lot of the profits to build a large size pastry shop. He is very dynamic and provides for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of flour, 10 kilos of margarine, a 25-liter jerrycan of cooking oil, 50 kilos of sugar and egg cartons.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a determined 32-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children. She has been selling beauty products for the last four years to earn her living. She wants, in the next five years, to have a big clientele and open another outlet of her business. She had earlier taken a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings, which she has repaid. She is now requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy health and beauty products.

loans.use: To buy health and beauty products

loans.name: Charlotte Adeline

texts.fr:
Cliente agee de 27 ans, celibataire et mere de deux enfants dont l'age varie entre 1 et 15 ans.Par manque de soutien a l'arret de ses etudes elle se lance dans le commerce des sandales. ses ventes sont considerables , car elle encaisse en moyenne 50.000fr par jour.

A l'octroi de son pret , elle va s'approvisionner en sandales hommes , sandales dames et enfants.
Avec ses benefices , elle envisage epargner pour aller acheter a l'etranger et devenenir grossiste , tres ambitieuse , elle fait face a la scolarite de son enfant et entreprend des relations de bon voisinage dans le quartier .
texts.en:
This customer is 27 years old, single and mother to two children, whose ages are one and 15. Due to lack of support once she had finished her studies she set herself up selling sandals and her sales are significant as she cashes in an average of 50,000 francs a day.

Once she is granted her loan she will get fresh supplies of men's, women's and children's sandals. With her profits she is planning to save up to go and buy abroad and become a wholesaler. She is very ambitious. She pays for her child's schooling and has good relationships with her neighbors in the district.

loans.use: to buy men's women's and children's sandals

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
El Sr Pascual vive en la ciudad de Santaní, tiene casa propia, es casado, es propietario de una despensa y carniceria,en su propio domicilio, bien surtidos con clientela bien formada.
El señor manifesto que empezo con una pequeña casilla, ventas de empanadas, milanesas, marineras y bebidas en general, siempre soñaba con tener una despensa y una carnicería. Su sueño es de ampliar su local para surtir mas su negocios, porque aveces le faltan las mercaderías y sus clientes tienen que buscar en otros lugares.
El se define como una persona muy responsable, trabajador, humilde y muy honesto.
El solicita el credito para la compra de carne, lácteos, bebidas en general y demás productos para la posterior venta.
texts.en:
Pascual lives in the city of Santaní.  He has a house of his own, is married and owns a home-based, well stocked general store and butcher shop with a well-established clientele.

He stated that he started out with a small kiosk selling turnovers, breaded steak, “marineras” (veal and seafood patties) and beverages.  He always dreamed with having a general store and butcher shop.  His dream is to expand the locale to have more stock because sometimes he lacks merchandise and his customers have to go elsewhere to look for it.

He defines himself as a very responsible, hardworking, humble and honest person.

He asked for the loan to buy meat, dairy products, assorted beverages and other products to resell.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Qambokwethu Group

texts.en:
Bizani is 54 years old and married with 6 children, between ages of 12 and 34 years old.  She also takes care of 2 relatives.  Three months ago, she opened a small store from her home where she sells cold drinks, cell phone minutes, and meat.  She receives additional income by working on a road maintenance crew for the South African government.

Bizani requested a loan from WDB and Kiva so that she can purchase chickens to raise for her store.  She faces difficulties right now because her store is new and has no customers, but she hopes that this loan will allow her to expand her stock and increase her customers.  With the income she generates from her store, she will send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cattle  to sell and increase his profits

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
El Sr Teodoro, tiene casa propia, es casado, vive en la ciudad de Santani.
Comenta que tiene una despensa por medio del cual puede paliar los gastos de la familia. Dice que la despensa la pudo tener por medio de mucho sacrificio ya que es una persona de escasos recursos. El objetivo de el es poder generar mas ingresos para ir así, de forma gradual, mejorando su calidad de vida, no solo de el sino de aquellos que dependen de el.
El solicita el credito para la compra de Bebidas, carnes, verduras, leche y demás para abastecer su negocio. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le esta brindando, ya que de obtener el credito le sera de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Teodoro has his own house, is married, and lives in the city of Santani. He told us that with his store he is able to help with his family's expenses. He said he was able to get the store by means of a lot of sacrifice since he does not have very much money. His goal is to be able to generate more income and gradually improve his quality of life and that of those who are dependent upon him.

He is asking for a loan to buy beverages, meat, vegetables, milk, and more to stock his store. He is thankful to the Foundation for the opportunity they are providing him, as getting a loan will be a big help to him.

loans.use: buy meat, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es: Ana Del Socorro tiene 54 años, su esposo le ayuda con el negocio su negocio es la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene 2 hijos pero solamente 1 está a su cargo. Comenzó hace 36 años atrás cuando aprendió la actividad como vendedora en un tramo del mercado fue así que logro obtener sus propios ingresos y mejorar cada día el inventario y tener su negocio. Labora todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar bolsos, calzado, toallas, sabanas, manteles, lápiz labial y otros.
texts.en: Ana Del Socorro is 54 years old.  Her husband helps her with her business selling general merchandise.  She has two children but only one is in her care.  She started working 36 years ago as a saleswoman on a stall in the market.  In this way, she managed to make her own income, continually improve her stock and keep her business running.  She works every day, from 7.00am to 9.00pm.  With the help of this loan, she would like to buy bags, footwear, towels, sheets, tablecloths, lipsticks, etc.

loans.use: to buy bags, footwear, towels, sheets, tablecloths, lipsticks, etc.

loans.name: Burmakan

texts.en:
Burmakan lives in Talas town in the north of Kyrgyzstan.  She is 59 years old, widowed and has 5 children.  Burmakan worked at the sewing factory for many years and is characterized as a very diligent and responsible person.  Now she is on pension and is engaged in cattle breeding with the support of her elder son.  

Having started it with the small amount of 5,000 Kyrgyz Soms to purchase cattle, Burmakan and her family managed to enlarge the number of animals to ten sheep, one horse and one cow. 

Being a persistent person, Burmakan applied to Bai Tushum and Partners for her first loan of 60,000 Kyrgyz soms for purchasing cattle and used it as intended and repaid without any delays. 

Burmakan has applied for a loan of 80,000 Kyrgyz Soms to purchase two colts.  With the revenues from the loan, she plans to broaden her business by purchasing cattle and building a barn.

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale

loans.name: Omar Leonardo

texts.es:
Omar Leonardo tiene 44 años, es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos de 12 y 15 años, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C EL PROGRESO, está ubicada a 15 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 13 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca.

Omar se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca  en tierras propias. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir trabajando y educar a los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Omar Leonardo is 44 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and his children, who are 12 and 15, in El Progreso, in Chillanes canton.

The 'El Progreso' community bank is located 15 minutes from our Chillanes office and has 13 members.  This is the third loan that they are requesting from Cooperativa San José.  The members of this bank are farmers who grow cacao, corn, bananas, soy and cassava.

Omar is a farmer who grows cacao, corn, bananas, soy and cassava on his own land.  He makes his purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and makes his sales in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

This loan will help Omar to buy supplies, fertilizers and manure for his crops.  Loans have supported him and helped increase his crop production.  He has faced challenges such as illnesses amongst his workers, pest infestations and plant diseases.  His dream is to enjoy good health so that he can continue working and educating his children.

In his spare time, he enjoys going for walks with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers and manure for his crops

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 35 years old, married and with four children in school.  She runs a tailoring business to earn a living.  Her business is only one year old.  

She was previously selling fabric to earn a living.  She also relies on her husband who is employed for financial support.  Jackline hopes to become financially stable in the future.  She has requested a 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Bulenga Twekembe Group B

texts.en:
Cheerful, courteous, warmhearted and easy to approach, 35-year-old Annet, the mother of five affable kids, has been diligently working to establish a place of vantage for her general merchandise retail business in Mpigi for the last 12 years. She established this business with capital from her food sales enterprise and has used the experience gained over the years to effectively plan and carry out implementation of her plans. The fact that she consistently takes stock of her successes and failures has also been of paramount significance, helping her to strike a balance in her operations. Her business success lies in the fact that she regularly restocks commodities that her clients want. Her shop appeals to many people-not only the rank and file but also the middle class.

This business generates Annet Ugandan shillings 120,000 weekly as sales profits. She says this Kiva loan money will help in the purchase of more retail commodities such as sugar, salt, local stoves, paraffin, soft drinks, candles, lamps, plastics, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, salt, local stoves, paraffin, soft drinks, candles, lamps, plastics, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines is 40 years old and married with four children ranging in age from 9 months to 21 years old.
