Ines is the owner and operator of a restaurant that serves local Peruvian dishes such as lomo saltado and various types of soup. Her restaurant is still in its early stages, as she just opened it half a year ago.

Ines is requesting a loan in order to generally improve the aesthetics of her restaurant. She plans on purchasing paint to make the restaurant more colorful. Very committed to the success of her new restaurant, she promises to make all the necessary repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy paint to improve the decor of her restaurant.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan is 34 years old, single and has two children aged 12 and 15. Juan has his own business working as a mechanic, mostly fixing the exterior of vehicles. He has been doing this sort of work for over ten years. With his loan, Juan plans on purchasing metal parts and paint to paint the vehicles. He also plans on buying various other parts that he will need. Juan is committed to making all the necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to buy paint and metal parts for his mechanic business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, a 33-year-old married mother of three children, has been operating a retail shop for the last five years, having previously sold vegetables. Caroline works hard in her business to provide for her children's needs, including their education. She attributes her business success to the good service she provides.

Now requesting a 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy rice and sugar, Caroline hopes to open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice.

loans.name: Eugenia Auriola

texts.es:
Eugenia Auriola tiene 30 años, es soltera vive con la  hija de 17 años, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C EL PROGRESO, está ubicada a 15 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 13 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca.

Eugenia Auriola se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca, ademas se dedica a la crianza de aves. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos y alimentacion para las aves, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es sewguir trabajando y ayudar en la educacion a la hija.

Le gusta visitar a los padres que viven en Chillanes.
texts.en:
Eugenia Auriola is 30 years old, single and she lives with her 17-year old mother. She lives in the enclosed community of El Progreso in the city of Chillanes. 

The members of the communal bank El Progreso, located at 15 minutes from the office in Chillanes, is made up of 13 members who request their third loan from the cooperative. The members of this group are agriculturists who cultivate cocoa, corn, bananas, soy beans, and yucca.

Eugenia Auriola is an agriculturist who cultivates cocoa, corn, bananas, soy beans, and yucca. She also raises poultry. She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and she carries out her sales at the Sunday fairs in Chillanes. 

The loan will help her purchase products, such as fertilizers and manure for her cultivation, and feed for her poultry. The loan has helped her increase production in her cultivations. She has faced challenges such as illnesses that have struck the workers, and plagues and diseases on the cultivations. Her dream is to keep working and to contribute to her daughter’s education. 

She enjoys visiting her parents who live in Chillanes.

loans.use: to purchase products such as fertilizers and manure for the cultivations and to purhcase feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 26 years old and the single mother of one child who is 13 months old. She buys all types of beauty products such as hair products, hair clips and perfumes, which she sells at various markets around the Cusco region. 

She has been successfully doing this work for about four years. Luisa is asking for a loan so that she may update the products that she sells by purchasing newer products. She plans to buy all kinds of new beauty products such as perfumes, lipsticks and shampoos. Luisa is committed to making all of the necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to buy the latest perfumes and hair products to sell at the market

loans.name: Dagbegnikin Group

texts.fr: Le groupement DAGBEGNIKIN est formé de onze personnes qui habitent toutes ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Philomène est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Philomène est âgée de 56 ans et est une veuve qui vit seule avec un de ses enfants. Philomène a en effet cinq enfants dont un seul reste encore à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Philomène n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a environs vingt ans que Philomène exerce comme activité, la vente de liqueurs, des vivres et des plastiques à son domicile. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins. Philomène s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Philomène désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire,  Philomène  sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement DAGBEGNIKIN , un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The DAGBEGNIKIN group is composed of eleven people who live together in the same neighborhood.  Philomène, the group’s representative, has her hand raised in the photo.  This is the third time that this group has requested a loan from ALIDé so as to increase their businesses.  Philomène is a 56 year old widow who lives alone with one of her children.  She actually has five children, although only one is still in her care.  All of her children have been to school.  Philomène didn’t attend school.   She has been operating a business selling liqueurs, food supplies and plastics from her home for around twenty years.  This business enables her to support her family without great difficulty and to provide for their needs.  Philomène gets her supplies in Benin.  She wants to increase her stock of products so as to better meet customer demand.  To do this, Philomène, along with the other DAGBEGNIKIN  group members, is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy liqueurs and bags of corn.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she rents. She has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.
Harriet has a food stall business. She has been in this business for four years, and she works one day a week. Harriet sells her products at the market by means of wholesale/retail. Harriet has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of beans, bunches of bananas and Irish potatoes. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing beans herself and also to sell on a wholesale basis only.

loans.use: to buy more bags of beans, bunches of bananas and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 40 years old and married with two children. Her children are 14 and 17 years old and both attend school. Marina's business is selling crafts at various markets around the Cusco region. She makes all of the crafts she sells, such as hats and small bags. With this loan, Marina plans on purchasing more wool and thread to make a greater number of crafts that she can sell. She is very hardworking and works every day of the week making products or selling them at different markets.

loans.use: to buy more wool and thread to make crafts.

loans.name: Segunda Adelaida

texts.es:
Segunda Adelaida tiene 30 años, es soltera vive con los  hijos de 15 y 16 años, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C EL PROGRESO, está ubicada a 15 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 13 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca.

Segunda Adelaida se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maíz, plátano, soya y yuca, ademas se dedica a la crianza de aves de casa. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos, ademas alimentacion para las aves el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y ayudar en la educación a la hija.

Le gusta visitar a los padres que viven en Chillanes.
texts.en:
Segunda Adelaida is 30 years old, single, and she lives with her children who are 15 and 16 years old. She lives in the enclosed community of El Progreso in the cit of Chillanes. 

The members of the communal bank El Progreso, located at 15 minutes from the office in Chillanes, is made up of 13 members who request their third loan from the cooperative. The members of this group are agriculturists who cultivate cocoa, corn, bananas, soy beans, and yucca.

Segunda Adelaida is an agriculturist who cultivates cocoa, corn, bananas, soy and yucca. She also raises poultry. She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and she carries out her sales at the Sunday fairs in Chillanes. 

The loan will help her purchase more products such as fertilizers and manure for the cultivations, and she will also be able to feed her poultry. The loan will help her increase production in her cultivations. She has faced challenges such as illnesses that have struck the workers, and plague and diseases on the cultivations. Her dream is to keep working and to contribute to her daughter’s education. 

She enjoys visiting her parents who live in Chillanes.

loans.use: to purchase products such as fertilizers and manure, and to purchase feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.en: Gricelda is 37 years old and a single mother to her daughter, who is seven years old. Gricelda's occupation is selling nutritional products, which she has been doing for over seven years. She sells all types of vitamins and other nutrient-rich products. Gricelda is asking for a loan to pay for her daughter's education. Her daughter still has a lot of schooling left and Gricelda wants to make sure that she receives the best possible education and opportunities. Gricelda is a responsible woman and is committed to making all the necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 26 years old, married and blessed with a one-year-old child. He operates a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He has been in this business for three years. He was able to buy a motorbike with his previous loan from Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. Daniel hopes to grow his business for more income generation. He has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.en: Julio Cesar is 32 years old and married with two children aged 9 and 14. He has a business selling car parts and also fixing up cars to sell. Julio Cesar has been doing this work for about four years and enjoys it a lot. With this loan, he plans to purchase more vehicles that he can fix up and then sell. As a result of buying more cars, Julio Cesar hopes to be able to expand his business. He is committed to making all the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more vehicles to sell.

loans.name: Qalakoncane Group

texts.en:
Getrude is widowed with five children between the ages of 28 and 43. She operates a small store from her home where she sells chickens and sleeping mats. Getrude has been in business for five years and she has three employees. She also receives income from an old age pension program provided by the South African government.

Getrude is requesting a loan from WDB and Kiva to purchase more chickens and sleeping mats to sell. In five years, she hopes to become a wholesaler of chickens and mats to other entrepreneurs. Getrude’s biggest business challenge is that her customers buy on credit and do not repay her. She would like to thank WDB and Kiva and she hopes to make a lot of money from this loan!

loans.use: to buy chickens and sleeping mats to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a hard-working, single 32-year-old. For the past three years, he has been selling second-hand clothing to support himself. 

Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and manage his business. He wants to open other shops in the next five years. His dream is to expand his business into wholesale.

He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is 21 years old and single. She is involved in a furniture-making business with her mother and sister. Together, they operate a family-owned furniture store for which they make all their own products. Alicia and her family are very devoted to their business and wish to begin making even more furniture. With this loan, Alicia plans to buy more wood so that she can produce more furniture. She will also buy any other materials that her family needs for their business. Alicia and her family are committed to making all the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more wood for her family's furniture-making business.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.es: El señor Johnny es abogado y trabaja en una institución en el área de logística y también realiza todo tipo de trámites en la procuraduría. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora portátil para desarrollar su trabajo más eficientemente. JOHNNY vive en alquiler en una casa,  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y de Kiva.
texts.en: Johnny is a lawyer and he works in an institution in the field of logistics and he also undertakes all types of processes in court. He requires the loan to purchase a laptop computer, to make his work more efficient. Johnny lives in a rental house which is located in Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. He is single and he does not have children. It is the first time he requests a loan from Impro (Kiva Field Partner) and from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to help him work more efficiently.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 53 years old. She has seven children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.
Hoa's husband has been sick for some time. Hoa takes care of him and feeds her family members through the income she earns selling vegetables in a small market. Hoa has sold vegetables at the market for nearly 30 years. Hoa would like to have a loan to invest in her current business and purchase a wider range and greater quantity of vegetables to sell. She hopes that this will permit her to generate a higher income and enable her to save for family emergencies.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell at the market.

loans.name: Luz Beatriz

texts.es:
Luz Beatriz tiene 57 años, es soltera vive con la  hija, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C EL PROGRESO, está ubicada a 15 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 13 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca.

Luz se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maíz, plátano, soya y yuca. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener buena salud y trabajar muy duro para tener dinero para la educacion de la hija.

Le gusta salir de paseo con la hija.
texts.en:
Luz Beatriz is 57 years old, single, and she lives with her daughter in the enclosed community of El Progresso in the city of Chillanes. 

The members of the communal bank El Progreso, located at 15 minutes from the office in Chillanes, is made up of 13 members who request their third loan from the cooperative. The members of this group are agriculturists who cultivate cocoa, corn, bananas, soy beans, and yucca.

Luz is an agriculturist who cultivates cocoa, corn, bananas, soy and yucca. She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and she carries out her sales at the Sunday fairs in Chillanes.

The loan will help her purchase more products such as fertilizers and manure for the cultivations. The loan will help her increase production in her cultivations. She has faced challenges such as illnesses that have struck the workers, and plagues and diseases on the cultivations. Her dream is to keep working and to contribute to her daughter’s education.

She enjoys traveling with her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase products such as fertilizers and manure for the cultivations.

loans.name: Arise Club Group

texts.en:
John is 28 years old and has been in the motorcycle transportation business in Mpigi for seven years. The good-humored father of two is a go-getter who knows the only way to get enough to survive is to work hard and put in long hours, sometimes burning the midnight oil. Mpigi is not so busy a town and it’s small. This means John has to strain every nerve to make ends meet most of the time. Most people are poor and cannot afford even basic commodities. It becomes difficult, therefore, to get clients who are willing to part with the modest money they have.
This is not a business for the faint-hearted and John knows it. It is not in his nature, however, to sulk nor is he predisposed to depression. He has to provide for his family and handle his other responsibilities. He therefore has no choice but to work hard. John also does some modest commercial farming at his small village farm. He grows bananas, cassava, maize and beans. His weekly business sales profits total 70,000 Shillings. John says he will use his Kiva loan to purchase better spare parts for his motorcycle and also maize and bean seeds to plant.

loans.use: to purchase better spare parts for his motorcycle and also maize and bean seeds to plant.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Uganda. She is married and has five children, two of whom are in school. Edith lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication and school fees.
Edith has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days a week. Edith sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Edith include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling wholesale only and also to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 41 years old. He is a quiet, hardworking and focused businessman. He is married and blessed with two children aged three and nine. For the last six years, he has been providing for his family by running a general store. Previously, he was employed as a technician. Peter hopes to open up a supermarket in the next five years. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy sugar, sodas and maize flour and to renovate his shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sodas and maize flour, and to renovate his shop.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George began his New Iberia, Louisiana-based business, Big Dooley’s Express, to fulfill his long-time goal of working for himself instead of someone else. Six years ago, after five years in the carrier business, George decided to pursue an opportunity to purchase a FedEx truck and route from another FedEx contractor. By becoming a FedEx contractor, George was able to work for himself while guaranteeing the business stability of a large, established company.

However, becoming a contractor for FedEx was not easy, says George. Firstly, breaking into the world of FedEx contracting is extremely difficult. Of this, he says, “Starting out without a route makes it hard to obtain another contractor’s business. When you have four or five routes and trucks, you have the income and reputation needed to secure new routes.” Contractors with more than one route also have access to yearly bonuses that single-route owners do not, allowing them more freedom to expand.

Additionally, George says that securing and maintaining employees with only one route is extremely difficult. “When you only have one route, you cannot really pay your employees the top dollar that you’d like to, so keeping reliable work around is difficult at this stage in the game.” He currently has one employee, but he says the turn-over happens more quickly than he’d like.

However, according to George, these problems can all be easily resolved by growing his business to include more routes. Not only will the additional routes bring in more capital and give him access to quarterly bonuses from FedEx, it will also allow him to pay his employees more and provide them with health insurance. Ultimately, he’d like to have “enough employees to sustain a smoothly running business.”

After being denied a loan at a commercial bank, he came to Kiva Partner MFI, Accion Texas-Louisiana, and was able to secure a loan in enough time to buy the new truck in anticipation of using it to fulfill the needs of a new route. He will pounce on the opportunity to buy a new route from another contractor as soon as one presents itself, he says. With the addition of this route, he will be able to secure a new employee along with the bonus capital, which he will use to finance higher pay for his employees and even more route expansions in the future.

Without this loan, George says that he might have missed out on the opportunity to purchase his new truck. He hopes, with the help of his loan, to continue serving his New Iberia community with reliable carrier service for years to come.

loans.use: to pay for a new FedEx truck and route.

loans.name: Danson

texts.en:
Danson is a hardworking 38-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children ages six, eight and 11. His children attend school. Danson has been providing for his family for the last 14 years by selling households goods. He supplements his income by providing transport with his hand cart. 

Danson is requesting an 80,000 KES loan to buy shoes, slippers, mats, batteries, energy-saving cookers, soap, and electronic sockets to sell. In the next five years he hopes to expand his business by at least 50% from its current value. Danson’s dreams and aspirations are to own a big business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Isaac Alberto

texts.es:
Isaac Alberto tiene 68 años, es soltero vive solo, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Canton Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C EL PROGRESO, está ubicada a 15 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 13 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca.


Isacc se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maíz, plátano, soya y yuca, ademas se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos y alimentación para las pollos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando.

Le gusta le gusta salir a visitar a los nietos.
texts.en:
Isaac Alberto is 68 years old, single, and he lives alone. He lives in the enclosed community of El Progreso in the city of Chillanes.

The members of the communal bank El Progreso, located at 15 minutes from the office in Chillanes, is made up of 13 members who request their third loan from the cooperative. The members of this group are agriculturists who cultivate cocoa, corn, bananas, soy beans, and yucca. He also raises poultry. He carries out his purchases in Chillanes and in San Pablo and he makes his sales at the Sunday fairs in Chillanes.

The loan will help him to purchase products such as fertilizers and manure for the cultivations and to feed his poultry. The loan will help him increase harvest production. He has faced challenges such as illnesses that struck the workers and plagues and diseases that affect the cultivations. His dream is to remain healthy and to keep working. 

He enjoys visiting with his grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase products such as fertilizers and manure for the cultivations and to purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El señor Luís es músico y también trabaja efectuando legalizaciones de documentos ante las autoridades correspondientes para el buffet de abogados para el que trabaja. De esta manera complementa sus ingresos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una guitarra eléctrica  para su grupo musical y así atender acontecimientos sociales por las noches y los fines de semana. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. Sus ganas de progresar profesionalmente y el flujo de caja analizado por nuestro oficial de créditos influyen en la aceptación que IMPRO ha dado a su solicitud de crédito.
texts.en:
Luís is a musician.  He also works preparing legal documentation, to be submitted to the corresponding authorities, for the lawyer's office he works for.  This is how he supplements his income.

Luís needs this loan to buy an electric guitar for his band.  This will enable him to work at social events in the evenings and at weekends.

Luís lives in his parents' home which is located in San Pedro district, in the city of La Paz.  He is single and doesn't have any children.  This is the first time that he has requested a loan.  Luís' desire to make progress professionally and the cash flow analysis that our loan officer carried out on him meant that IMPRO accepted his loan request.

loans.use: to buy an electric guitar for his band

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: La señora Erika  tiene dos movilidades que trabajan en el transporte publico de pasajeros. Así obtiene los ingresos mensuales necesarios para mantener a sus dos hijas y ella misma. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción ya que hará la refacción de una habitación en su casa .Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona San Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz; Erika es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO y de Kiva.
texts.en: Erika has two vehicles that provide a public passenger transport service.  This makes her the monthly income that she needs to support her two daughters and herself.  She needs this loan to buy building supplies as she will refurbish a room in her home.  She lives in her own home which is located in San Antonio district, in the city of La Paz.  Erika is a single mother and has two daughters.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to refurbish a room in her home

loans.name: Acencion Felipe

texts.es: Acencion Felipe vive en el reparto Ronal, administra su negocio que es una pulpería. En donde la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar los diferentes productos que ofrece. Tiene más de 13 años en este negocio, el trabaja con proveedores, quienes le llevan la mercadería para el negocio, trabaja todos los días de la semana. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar granos básicos, golosinas, sal, fósforos, papel higiénico, sopas y enlatados esto le ayudara a tener mucho más clientes. El sueño de es lograr que su pulpería siga creciendo.
texts.en: Acencion Felipe lives in Reparto Ronal, where he runs his own corner shop which is attended by many customers coming to his place to buy the different products he sells. He has been running his shop for more than 13 years. He works every day of the week, and his suppliers bring to him the products for the shop. He is currently asking for a loan to buy basic grains, candies, salt, matches, toilet paper, soups and canned food. This will help him gaining more customers. He wishes that his corner shop activity will keep on growing.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, candies, salt, matches, toilet paper, soups and canned food.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a creative 43-year-old businesswoman. She is widowed with one child who is in college. Jane makes her living by selling second-hand clothes and she also works as a teacher. Previously, she used to run a catering business. 

Jane is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy more clothes to sell. In the next five years, she would like to become a wholesale dealer. Her dream is to open up a large store.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Union Y Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "UNION Y ESFUERZO" porque para el grupo es estar unidas en todos los momentos de la vida y esforzarse por cumplir sus metas. Esta ubicado en el Estado de México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La señorita Adriana tiene 19 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria, es comerciante y no tiene hijos. Ella tiene una taqueria como actividad principal desde hace aproximadamente 2 años como actividad adicional se dedica a la venta de zapato por catalogo pues le gusta tener varios negocios y buscar opciones de salir adelante para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Quiere este prestamo para invertirlo en mobiliario, insumos, zapatos que le piden sus clientes. Sus clientes la prefieren porque sus tacos son muy ricos y simpre tiene limpio su negocio además de que entrega sus pedidos a tiempo y en pagos flexibles. Al solicitar el prestamo ella se siente entusiasmada y apoyar a su familia en los gastos familiares, debido a la gran demanda que tiene en su taqueria piensa más adelante ampliar su local, lo cual le permita darle una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
texts.en: This group is called 'Union and Strength' because this group is focused on remaining united at every moment of their lives and working to meet their goals. They are located in the state of Mexico.  The group has 9 members.  Miss Adriana is 19 years old and studied until high school.  She is a saleswoman and does not have children.  She has run a taco stand as a main job for about two years and as a second job works selling shoes through a catalog.  She likes to have many businesses and look for new ways to get ahead and offer her family a better quality of life.  She wants this loan to invest in furniture, supplies, and shoes that her customers order.  Her customers prefer her stand because her tacos are very tasty and her business is always clean.  She also delivers their orders on time and allows for flexible payments.  She is enthusiastic about asking for this loan to help with her family's expenses.  Thanks to the popularity of her taco stand she plans to expand it in the future in order to provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: invest in furniture, supplies, and shoes

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Uganda. She is married and has six children, two of whom are in school. Betty lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent and school fees
Betty has a business selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days a week. She sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Betty has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. The main business challenges for Betty include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 37 years old. He is a hardworking and determined businessman who believes in achievement. He is married and blessed with five children, three of whom are in school. He has been doing quarrying for the last four years to provide for his family. His dream is to be a great and successful businessman. Charles is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy blasting materials and tools and to pay new laborers.

loans.use: to buy blasting materials and tools and to pay new laborers.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: La señora Lorenza se dedica a la costura y su esposo es albañil. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (arena fina, estuco, pintura) ya que hará la construcción de una habitación en obra fina .Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene dos hijos. Lorenza está solicitando un crédito por segunda vez a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Lorenza is a seamstress and her husband is a mason. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials (fine sand, stucco and paint) in order to complete the finishing works of a room. She lives in her own house in Pasankeri, a neighborhood of the city of La Paz, she is married and she has two children. This is the second time Lorenza is asking for a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fine sand, stucco and paint to complete the finishing works of a room of her house.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El Sr. Victor tiene 52 años, es soltero, con un hijo llamado Oscar que tiene 21 años, viven en casa propia y los 2 se encargan de hacer trabajar en su domicilio una casa de costura. 
Victor se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir con ayuda de 3 personas para una empresa en la capital del país. Victor nos cuenta que empezó a los 14 años en el ramo de costura y ya llevan 23 años en la actividad, cuenta con mucha experiencia y con clientela formada debido a la buena calidad de sus productos.
Se define como un hombre muy trabajador y luchador, no tiene miedo al trabajo. Su esfuerzo es para poder día a día generar mayores ingresos. Solicita el credito para la compra de telas, hilos y demás insumos para el ejercicio de su profesión.
texts.en:
Victor is 52 years old, single, and has a 21-year old son named Oscar. They live in their own home and both work from the home as tailors. Victor works sewing clothing along with three other people for a business in the country's capital. Victor shares that he began working in the sewing field when he was 14 years old and has now been doing this work for 23 years. He has a lot of experience and regular customers due to the good quality of his products.

He describes himself as a hardworking man who is a fighter and not afraid to work. His works hard to earn more money each day. He is asking for a loan to buy fabric, thread, and other supplies for his profession.

loans.use: buy fabric and thread for his profession

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, two of whom attend school.  Joyce has a business selling sugar cane.  She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days a week. Joyce sells her products at the market, by means of retail. She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of sugar cane.     

The main business challenges for Joyce include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell wholesale only and also to buy a plot of land.  Joyce lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication, feeding the family, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of sugar cane.

loans.name: Francisco I Madero Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Francisco I Madero" porque así se llama la calle donD. se reúne el grupo, esta ubicado en el estado D. Morelos en México, el grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes y es la tercera  vez que solicitan un prestamo. Cristina es la tesorera del grupo, tiene 38 años, estudio hasta el tercer año D. secundaria, es serigrafista, tiene en total 3 hijos (1 mujer y 2 varones), ella se dedica a la serigrafía negocio que inicio hace 4 años, solicita el préstamo para comprar una maquina D. coser industrial con la que podra bordar gorras, banderines, logotipos para las escuelas. Al momento D. solicitar el prestamo se siente contenta porque tendrá  mas trabajo y la oportunidad D. mejorar su negocio. Con las ganancias que obtenga espera arreglar su casa para ofrecerle una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia así como educación para que puedan salir adelante. Observaciones, la señora que no se ve en la foto se llama Mirian.
texts.en:
This group is called “Francisco I. Madero”, the name of the street where the group meets in the state of Morelos, Mexico. The group is composed of 10 members and this is the 3rd time they have solicited a loan.

Cristina is the group's treasurer. She is 38 years old and studied up to the 3rd year of secondary school. Cristina is a silk-screen printer and has 3 children (1 female and 2 males). She has been in the silk-screen printing business for 4 years. Cristina is soliciting this loan to buy an industrial sewing machine so she can embroider caps, banners, or school logos.

Cristina feels content because she will have more work and the opportunity to better her business. With the earnings she will obtain, Cristina hopes to remodel her house and proviD. a better quality of life for her family, plus education so that her children can get ahead.

Observation: the woman you don't see in the photo is called Mirian.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine for embroidering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as maize flour, soft drinks, sugar, beans, plastics, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. Joyce lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, feeding the family and school fees.  

She has a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Joyce has requested for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. The main business challenges for Joyce include seasonality and transportation.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are own a bridal salon and also to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
El Señor Juan tiene 46 años de edad, es divorciado, vive en la ciudad de Villarrica, cuenta con casa propia.
El se dedica a la albañilería dentro y fuera de su ciudad. Debido a que tiene muchos trabajos necesita de herramientas que faciliten y agilicen su labor diaria, pues así incrementara su ingreso y tendrá un mejor nivel de vida.
El se define como un hombre muy trabajador ya que su profesión es muy sacrificada ya que requiere un gran esfuerzo físico y mental.
Solicita el credito para la compra de herramientas que va a utilizar en su profesión. El tiene las esperanzas puestas en el credito, ya que le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan is 46, divorced and lives in the city of Villarrica in his own house.  He is a bricklayer and works in and outside of the city.  Because of the many jobs he has, he needs a set of tools that will make his work day more flexible.  This will allow him to increase his income and improve his lifestyle.

He defines himself as a hard worker since his profession requires a lot of sacrifice and much physical and mental effort.

He is requesting a loan to buy the tools he needs and has high hopes that the loan will be of great assistance to him.

loans.use: To buy tools for his construction trade.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. Esther lives in a home that she owns. She has access to piped water but not to electricity. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees and medical fees.   

Esther has a business of selling second-hand shoes. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works five days out of every week. 

Esther sells her products at the market by means of retail.  

Esther has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of shoes.  

The main business challenges for Esther include transportation and the rainy season.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes and also to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Catalino Abelino

texts.es: EL Señor Catalino Abelino tiene 45 años, está casado y tiene dos hijos a su cargo. el tiempo que tiene con este negocio es de 8 años pero tiene todas las ganas de querer trabajar y salir adelante por ese motivo es que ha decidido realizar este financiamiento con el fin de comprar granos básicos, golosinas, jugos, pan, fósforos, enlatados, agua embotellada y sopas. Catalino tiene el objetivo de  agrandar su negocio, pues la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a solicitarle una gran variedad de productos. Gracias a los préstamos ha podido hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en: Catelino Abelino, 45, is married and has 2 children in his care. He has been working in this business for 8 years and has a great desire to work hard and get ahead. For that reason he has decided to get a loan in order to buy basic grains, snacks, juices, bread, matches, canned goods, bottled water and soups. Catalino's goal is to increase the size of his business since the majority of his customers come to ask him for a wide variety of products. Thanks to the loans he has been able to realize his dreams.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, juices, bread, matches, canned goods, bottled water and soups.

loans.name: Jacquline

texts.en:
Jacquline is a 45-year-old entrepreneur who is widowed and has three children between the ages of 13 and 28 years old. All of her children are in school.

She has been selling fruits since 1999 and has recently started to sell wholesale.

She needs a loan to buy more fruits and make more profits. With this loan, she will purchase tomatoes, passion fruits and mangoes that she will sell at her business.

She plans to use the profits from her business to pay the school fees for her children and also to save money for her and her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, passion fruits and mangoes for resale.

loans.name: Las Amigas De San Ildefonso Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LAS AMIGAS DE SAN IDELFONSO" porque como su nombre lo indica, ha nacido una gran amistad entre todas sus integrantes a lo largo que han trabajado juntas, ya que para ellas un “amigo”, es aquel que esta en las buenas y en las malas. Esta ubicado en Hidalgo en México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Leticia es integrante del grupo, tiene 28 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, es comerciante y tiene 3 hijos (1 mujer y 2 varones). Ella se dedica a la venta de manualidades (adornos de migajon) desde hace 6 años. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en mercancia y de esta forma hacer crecer su negocio. Solicita el prestamo para comprar materia prima como miga de plan blanco, pegamento, glicerina, pinturas para teñis, etc. Ella se siente entusiasmada ya que piensa hacer mayores inversiones, y de esta forma comenzar a tener mas ganancias que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida a ella y a toda su familia, debido a la gran demanda que tiene piensa rentar un local que le de mayor formalidad a su negocio y una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Amigas de San Idelfonso" because, as the name indicates, all the members have become great friends during the time that they've worked together. To them, a "friend" is someone who is there in good times and in bad. They are located in Hidalgo, Mexico. The group is made up of 10 members. 

Leticia, 28, is one group member. She studied until high school. She is a merchant and has 3 children (1 girl and 2 boys). She has been selling crafts (decorations made with a breadcrumb paste) for 6 years. She asks for a loan to invest in merchandise and help her business to grow. She wants to buy basic materials like white breadcrumbs, glue, glycerine, paints for dyeing, etc. She is excited because she thinks that making a bigger investment will begin to help her to make more money, which will allow her and her family a better quality of life. She feels a great need to rent a store where she can formalize her business and provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy input materials like white bread crumbs, glue, glycerine, paints for dyeing, etc.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.fr:
Cliente de 42 ans, celibataire avec 4 enfants a sa charge,apres son divorce en 2007, pour subveenir au besoins des ses enfants, elle se lance dans le commerce des friperies comme ballot de je pantalon en jeans, body, et des marinieres pour enfants et adultes.
Sa strategie est de jouer sur son stock, avoir plusieurs articles et jouer sur le prix.Ses revenus sont considerables, elle vend en moyenne 8000 a 25000frs. 

A l'octroi de son pret elle va acheter des ballots de jeans, ballot de body et des marinieres pour enfant , hommes et dames.
A l'avenir elle veut ouvrir un depot de friperie , aller acheter a Kinshasa et Pointe Noire et avec les benefices , elle epargne pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et s'occuper aussi de la scolarite de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This customer is 42 years old, single and has four children in her care. In order to provide for her children's needs after her divorce in 2001 she began selling second-hand clothes, such as bundles of jeans, body stockings and smocks for children and adults. Her strategy is to play with her stock, have several different articles and play on the prices. Her income is significant, she sells on average between 8,000 and 25,000 francs.

Once she has been granted her loan she is going to buy bundles of jeans, body stockings and smocks for children, men and women. In the future she would like to open a second-hand clothing store, go to Kinshasa and Pointe Noire to buy goods, and with the profits to save money in order to provide for her family's needs and also take car of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bundles of jeans, body suits, smocks

loans.name: Aner Eliu

texts.es: El señor Aner, es habitante de municipio de Veracruz , junto a su esposa , los planes hacia un futuro es poder terminar de construir su vivienda , ya que con créditos anteriores ah logrado construir gran parte de la misma , el labora en una empresa privada , la mayor afectación  que se le presenta es no poder contar con un  salario que cubra de una sola vez la  compra de materi ales de construcción como  de zinc , perlines , entre otros .
texts.en: Aner lives with his wife in the municipality of Veracruz. Their plan for the future is to finish building their house, since with previous loans they've been able to construct a large part of it. He works in a private business. The main problem is not having a salary that will cover the costs of all the construction materials like tin roofing and rafter beams, among other things.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie lives in Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is in school. Sophie lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business premises and paying utility bills.   

Sophie has a business of a pub. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days out of every week.  

Sophie sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale and retail .     

Sophie has requested  for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and soda.    

The main business challenges for Sophie include transportation and seasonality.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked pub and a beer depot (where she can sell beer wholesale).

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Martheis is 43 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom attend school.  She is a  Rwandan entrepreneur, who has been running her own general store since 2004.  Originally, she only sold green bananas, but she has expanded her business and added new products to her inventory.  

Martheis is requesting a loan to purchase these new items such as flour, onions, cooking oil, and chicken that she will sell  to meet the demands of her customers. With the profits from her business, Marthe plans to save enough to ensure the well-being of her family and also provide the start-up capital for her husband to start his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase items such as flour,onions, cooking oil. etc.

loans.name: Sonia Concepcion

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo adolescente de 14 años con quien vive en la ciudad de Villarrica.
Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de bazar como cubiertos, vasos, platos y además de eso a la venta de colchones. Empezó gracias a la ayuda de su madre, y con mucho esfuerzo va logrando salir adelante. Comenta que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por un mejor porvenir para su hijo, puesto que quiere brindarle una vida sin privaciones ni necesidades.
Ella solicita el credito para abastecer su stock de mercaderías como ser cubiertos, vasos y demás,  ya que sabe que si tiene mas variedad de artículos podrá atraer a mas clientes. Esta con las esperanzas puestas en el credito ya que sabe que le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Sonia, 41, is a single mother and lives with her adolescent son, age 14, in the city of Villarrica.  She sells bazar articles such as cutlery, glasses, plates and even mattresses.  She began her business thanks to her mother and with much effort has been able to get ahead.  All of the effort she puts into her work is for her son's future, since she does not want him to be deprived of anything he might need in life.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as cutlery, glasses, and other items, since having more variety of products will attract more customers.  She has high hopes placed on the loan because she knows it will be very helpful.

loans.use: To buy cutlery, glasses, plates and other items.

loans.name: Clarisa Guillermina

texts.es: Clarisa Guillermina de 64 años, posee el negocio de brindar los servicios de costura, la cual es muy visitada por las personas de la localidad pues ella realiza las mejores prendas a muy buenos precios, además ocupa tela de excelente calidad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre está al frente de su competencia. Es por eso que solicito un crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, tijeras, encajes, bordados, botones,  sierres entre otros. De esta forma ella está haciendo crecer el negocio y tiene la confianza de que en algún futuro lograra darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Clarisa Guillermina is 64 years old and has a business providing dressmaking services.  Her business is very popular with the people in her town as she makes the best garments at very good prices.  She also uses excellent-quality fabric.

Clarisa Guillermina is a very hard-working woman who is always ahead of the competition.  For this reason, she requested a loan to buy fabric, thread, scissors, lace, embroidered fabric, buttons, fasteners, etc.  In this way, she is growing her business and she trusts that in the future she will be able to provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, scissors, lace, embroidered material, buttons and fasteners

loans.name: Salvador Antonio

texts.es: El señor Salvador , es habitante de Masaya , junto a su esposa e hijos , los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , el labora en  una empresa privada , su esposa le apoya con los gastos del hogar  ; ya que tiene un pequeño negocio , juntos luchan día a día para brindarle estudios a sus pequeños y lograr que ejerzan  una carrera profesional para que no pasen dificultades como las han sufridos ambos , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no cuenta con un salario suficiente para poder comprar de una solo vez materiales de construcción y mejorar la vivienda , agradece la Confianza que le  brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo para poder realizar sus sueños de ver su casa en mejor estado .
texts.en: Señor Salvador lives in Masaya with his wife and children.  His plans for the future are to be able to improve his living conditions.  He works for a private company, and his wife helps with the household expenses, as she has a small business.  They struggle together on a daily basis to provide their young ones with education and to ensure that they have a professional career that will allow them to bypass difficulties like those that both Salvador and his wife have suffered.   The greatest challenge he faces is that he does not earn a sufficient salary to be able to make a one-off purchase of building materials and improve his home.  He appreciates the trust that is being given to him through Afodenic, which fundamentally will achieve his dream of seeing his home in better shape.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Americo

texts.es: El señor Américo trabaja como chofer en una compañía de radio taxis y su esposa es vendedora en una tienda donde vende ropa de bebe. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de llantas para su vehiculo de transporte de pasajeros. Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona Pasankeri en  la ciudad de La Paz;  es casado y tiene tres hijos. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Américo works as a driver in a radio taxi company.  His wife works as a sales assistant in a store selling baby clothes.

Américo needs this loan to buy tires for his passenger transport vehicle.  He lives in a rental house in Pasankeri district, in the city of La Paz.  He is married and has three children.  This is the first time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tires for his passenger transport vehicle

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia es artesana, trabaja tejiendo chompas de lana y vendiendo las mismas. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de lana en mayor cantidad, pues debido a la temporada de invierno, sus chompas son muy requeridas y debe aprovechar esta oportunidad para mejorar sus ingresos la menos por los dos meses que restan al invierno. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Huayna Potosi en  la ciudad de El Alto; es soltera y no hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y en Kiva.
texts.en:
Julia is a craftswoman who works knitting and selling woolen sweaters.  She needs this loan to buy yarn in larger quantities because her sweaters are very much needed in the winter season and she would like to make the most of this opportunity to improve her income over the two remaining winter months.

Julia lives in her own home which is located in the Huayna Potosi district, in the city of El Alto.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  This is the first time that she has obtained a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy yarn for her business knitting sweaters

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: El señor Manuel es chofer, tiene un taxi de servicio de transporte de pasajeros. Manuel también estudia la carrera de Comunicación Social. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora que le servirá para continuar sus estudios, pues muchas veces necesita efectuar investigaciones a través de la Internet y actualmente tiene que buscar lugares públicos con este tipo de servicio. Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicado en la zona Pasankeri en  la ciudad de La Paz;  es soltero  y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y se canaliza este crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Señor Manuel is a driver for a taxi company. He is also taking Social Communication courses.

He is seeking a loan to buy a computer which will help him with his studies as he often needs to do research on the internet. At the moment he has to go to public internet cafes to do this. 

Manuel lives in rented accommodation in the Pasankeri neighbourhood of La Paz. He is single and doesn’t have any children. This is the first loan he has taken out with Impro who are partnering with Kiva to provide the loan.

loans.use: to buy a computer so he can continue his studies

loans.name: Jeannette Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Jeannette tiene 35 años tiene cuatro hijos. Lleva más de 20 años trabajando en su negocio que es una pulpería.  Ella atiende el negocio desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, por lo que se ha caracterizado por tener un gran carisma con su cliente. Con éste crédito podrá comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, papel higiénico, fósforos, sal y enlatados. Este negocio le permite generar los ingresos que necesita para poder mantener a sus hijos y darle lo necesario para que puedan estudia.
texts.en:
35-year old Sra. Jeannette has four children. She’s had her grocery store business for more than twenty years. She works in the store from 7am to 9pm; her customers portray her as a very charismatic person.

With this loan Jeannette will buy basic grains, candy, bread, toilet paper, matches, salt and canned goods. The income from her business allows her to support her children and provide what is necessary for them to continue their studies.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, bread, toilet paper, matches, salt and canned goods

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, tiene la edad de 54 años, está casado y vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposa. El pretende con el crédito comprar los insumos necesarios para una excelente producción de café este año el cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo, el consta de una gran área sembrada y tiene que darle la asistencia necesaria para su buena cosecha. El pretende con estas mejoras generar las ganancias necesarias para seguir adelante con su familia y cumplir sus proyectos como un caficultor de la zona. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
54-year old Gerardo is married and lives with his wife and their five children. With the loan he plans to buy the supplies necessary to have an excellent coffee crop this year. He has good land for growing coffee and says that he’s planted a big area. Now he needs some assistance in order to get a good harvest.

With these improvements he will have a greater income and be better able to provide the necessities for his family as a successful coffee farmer. This is his first loan with Kiva partner FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with better repayment options and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his coffee fields

loans.name: Ana Celina

texts.es:
Ana es una pequeña comerciante con deseo de superacion, desde hace cuatro años logro la construccion de tres cuartos con el objetivo de alquiler, asi como un auto lavado.
Iniciando con prestamo en otros bancos, luego con Afodenic ha logrado la mejora  a su vivienda como: las mejoras a sus cuartos de alquiler, lo que quiere es cambiar el techo ya que es de cuartones de madera el cual comprara perlines, y laminas de zinc, asi como ventana y puertas, logrando dar mejor seguridad a sus inquilinos.
Contenta por lo que ha equilibrado sus ingresos, logrando apoyar a sus cuatro hijos, estando sastifecha al lograr mejores ventas en sus dos negocios. Como planes  a futuro es poder seguir dando mantenimiento a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is a small businesswoman who has a desire to do well in life.  Four years ago, she managed to build three rooms with the goal of renting them out.  She also built a car wash.

Starting out with loans from other banks, then from Afodenic, she has managed to make improvements to the rooms that she rents out.  What she would like to do now is replace the roof since the existing beams are made from wood.  She will buy 'perlines' (metal beams) and sheets of corrugated metal, as well as windows and doors.  This will increase her tenants' safety.

Ana is happy that she has managed to balance her income and support her four children.  She is happy that she is making better sales in her two businesses.  Her plan for the future is to continue maintaining her house.

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal, 'perlines' (metal beams) and bolts to replace a roof

loans.name: Oñoñe´eme Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado Oñoñe´eme esta integrado por 15 mujeres, todas ella de la ciudad de Asunción. Actualmente se encuentra en su segundo ciclo.
Ellas manifiestan que el grupo es muy responsable, todas las integrantes participan activamente, todo dentro de un ambiente de solidaridad y cooperación. Todas ellas tienen un fin en común que es la obtención de mayores ingresos para que de esa forma puedan solventar los gastos de la casa.
La Sra.Marciana se dedica a la venta de bijouteries, gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y mantenerse y mantener a su familia. Le gusta mucho el trabajo que hace ya que por medio de esto puede desarrollar su creatividad.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de los insumos que necesita para la elaboración de las bijouteries como ser cuentas, hilos, ganchos y demás.
texts.en:
The communal bank Oñoñe'eme is comprised of 15 women, all from the city of Asunción.  They are currently in their second loan cycle, and claim that the group is very responsible with all members actively participating in an atmosphere of support and cooperation.  Their common goal is to increase their incomes in order to cover household expenses.

Mrs. Marciana sells fashion jewelry and, through her work, has been able to get ahead and support her family.  She enjoys her work because it is a way to channel her creativity.

She is requesting a loan to buy the supplies she needs to make the jewelry, such as beads, thread, hooks, etc.

loans.use: To buy supplies to make fashion jewelry.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Camindo Juntos” pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa (Cusco, Perú) y las reuniones de las socias son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Papelpata de la ciudad de Quillabamba  departamento del Cusco. La comunidad se encuentra a unos treinta minutos de la ciudad de Quillabamba (Cusco, Perú). 

En esta comunidad de Papelpata conocimos a la señora Hilda nació en la misma comunidad, tiene 44 años de edad, tiene su pareja y tiene 2 hijos. Actualmente, Hilda vive en la misma comunidad y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas.  

Hilda tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio y se dedica a la crianza de animales y también  se dedica a la agricultura a la cosecha de café y cacao. Hila en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercedaria para la tienda y así poder abastecer su local con productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y otras cosas más y también va comprar animales menores como por ejemplo pollos y chancho.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Camindo Juntos" belongs to Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner) in Cusco, Peru. The members' meetings are held every thirty days in the community of Papelpata of the city of Quillabamba in the department of Cusco. The community is located at some thirty minutes from the city of Quillabamba (Cusco, Peru). 

In the community of Papelpata we met Hilda. She was born in the same community and she is 44 years old. She has a partner and she has 2 children. Hilda currently lives in the same community and she works in her business activities.

Hilda has a small grocery store in her house, she raises livestock, and she is an agriculturist who harvests coffee and cocoa. Hilda requires a loan to purchase merchandise for her store, in order to supply her business with basic consumer goods, such as rice, sugar, and other products. She also wants to purchase small livestock, such as poultry and pigs.

loans.use: to purchase basic consumer goods such as rice, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Pedro José es padre de familia de 33 años, vive con su esposa  y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 16 años labora brindando los servicios de carpintero, trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche para poder cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su familia. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de madera, herramientas, lijas, martillos clavos, pega y maque lo que le permitirá ofrecer mejores servicios y realizar la entrega pedidos que le han realizado. Pedro es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades académicas en un futuro.
texts.en: Pedro Jose is the father of a family, 33 years old, and he lives with his wife and their 3 children. For the past 16 years he has been providing carpentry services. He works every day from 7am to 9pm to provide for the daily needs of the family. He has requested a loan to purchase wood, tools, sanders, hammers, nails, glue, and lacquer. It will allow him to offer better services and to fill orders that have already been placed. Pedro is a very hardworking and responsible person. The only thing that he wants is for his children to have better academic opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wood, tools, sanders, hammers, nails, glue, and lacquer.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es: Leonel, tiene la edad de 40 años, está en unión libre y tiene un hijo bajo su responsabilidad. El pretende con el crédito comprar una máquina para chapear pasto. El trabaja en jardinería y no cuenta con esta máquina por lo cual necesita comprarla. Esto le facilitara su trabajo y le permitirá darle a sus trabajos una mejor calidad en el acabado de sus trabajos complaciendo a sus clientes y aumentando la clientela. El tiene como meta salir adelante con sus proyectos y tener mayores ganancias para su bienestar en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Leonel is 40 years old, he lives with his common-law partner, and he has one child in his care. With this loan he plans on purchase a grass trimmer. He works in landscaping and he doesn't have this machine, so he needs to buy one. It will facilitate his work and it will permit him to give his work a better finish, which will please his clients and increase his clientele. His goal is to move forward with his projects and to have better earnings for his future wellbeing. It is the first loan he received from Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). he has not previously had any loans with state banks but Fudecosur has granted him a loan with greater ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase a grass trimmer.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés, tiene la edad de 31 años, está en unión libre y vive con su señora esposa. El pretende con el crédito comprar los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de una siembra de café que realizo. El cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado y está en muy buenas condiciones por lo que quiere asistirlo para tener mejores rendimientos cuando coseche por primera vez. El pretende generar las ganancias para salir adelante con su proyecto nuevo y salir con las pagos de su crédito. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Andres is 31 years old, married common-law, and he lives with his wife. He plans on purchasing necessary products to maintain the coffee plantation he has started. He has an already-sown farm land which is in very good conditions. He wants to maintain it to have a better yield during the first-time harvest. He plans on generating a profit to move forward with his project and to make his loan payments. It is the first loan he receives from Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). He has not had previous loans with state banks, but Fudecosur has provided him with a loan with greater ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee plantation.

loans.name: San Isidro 11 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "San Isidro 11" porque L. comunidad en L. cual habitan son muy devotas al santo “San Isidro”. Esta ubicado en el estado D. México. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes y es L. primera vez que solcita un prestamo. MariC. es tesorera del grupo. Tiene 23 años, estudio hasta L. preparatoria. ElL.  
cuida a sus papas pues son personas D. edad avanzada a quienes quiere mucho. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza, negocio que inicio hace 1 año aproximadamente. Solicita este prestamo para comprar productos como fragancias, cremas y cosmeticos. Lo que elL. espera con este prestamo es que al final pueda tener sus productos a L. mano para que los exiba en un pequeño local que piensa construir para que cuando lo requieran sus clientes los tenga sin ningun inconveniente. Al momento solicitar este prestamo elL. se siente feliz porque pueD. surtir su negocio. Tambien quiere apoyar a sus papas en los gastos D. L. familia y brindarles una mejor vida para su vejez.
texts.en: The name of this group is "San Isidro 11" and it is named as such because the community in which they live is very devout to the saint "San Isidro". It is located in the state of Mexico. The group is maD. up of 11 members and it is the first time they request a loan. MariC. is the treasurer of the group. She is 23 years old and she has a high school education. She takes care of her parents who are advanced in age and whom she loves very much. She sells beauty products, a business she started approximately 1 year ago. She requests a loan to purchase products such as fragrances, skin lotions, and cosmetics. What she hopes with this loan is to finally have the products that she needs in hand and to display from a small store she's thinking about having built. So when clients require a product they will not be inconvenienced. When she requested the loan she felt very happy because she will be able to add inventory to her business. She also wants to support her parents with the family's expenses, and to proviD. them with a better life in their old age.

loans.use: to purchase products such as fragrances, skin lotions, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es:
El sr. Fidencio tiene 47 años y esta casado con la Sra. Mercedes de 52 años. Ellos tienen 3 hijos. La hija mayor tiene 23 años y actualmente estudia informática, un varón de 21 años que termino sus estudios secundarios y trabaja en una cerrajería, y una hija menor que esta cursando sus estudios secundarios.
El Sr. Fidencio es herrero, trabaja en esto desde los 16 años para distintos talleres pero decidió trabajar en forma independiente desde el año 1990, a los 27 años de edad. El se define como una persona sacrificada. Su objetivo siempre fue brindarle lo mejor a su familia, y que accedan a una educación universitaria.
El solicita el credito para la compra de chapas y otros tipo de hierros, y ademas de eso para la compra de  herramientas que necesita para ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
47 year-old Fidencio is married to 52 year-old Mercedes.  The couple have three children.  Their eldest daughter is 23 years old and currently studying IT.  Their 21 year-old son finished high school and works in a locksmith's.  Their youngest daughter is still in high school.

Fidencio is a blacksmith.  He has been in this trade for 16 years, working in different workshops.  However, he decided to start working for himself in 1990, when he was 27 years old.  He describes himself as a selfless person.  His goal has always been to provide his family with the best in life and to ensure his children have a university education.

Fidencio is requesting this loan to buy sheets of metal and other types of iron.  He will also buy tools that he needs to carry out his work.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal, iron and tools

loans.name: Sandra Luz

texts.es:
La joven sandra, tiene su propio negocio, una pulperia con dos años en las ventas, iniciando con poco productos y el apoyo de su esposo. Lo que ha vino a mejorar al invertir mas, lo que hizo a travez del financiamiento, siendo Afodenic quien abrio puerta a una mejora.
Sandra es madre de dos hijos, y su esposo labora en la agricultura, y lo que quiere hacer es levantar una pared lateral en su vivienda. Comprara materiales de construccion en bloques, hierro, bolsa de cemento, piedrin, arana. Logrando a si comenzar la obra, dando a sus hijos merjor condiciones de vivienda.
texts.en:
Sandra is a young woman who owns her own business.  She has a grocery store which she has owned for two years.  She started out with just a few products and the support of her husband.  She has improved her business by investing in it.  She did this through a loan.  It was Afodenic who opened the door to the improvement for her.

Sandra is the mother of two children.  Her husband works in agriculture.  What she would like to do is build a concrete side wall for her home.  She will buy building materials such as blocks, iron, cement, gravel and sand.  This will allow her to begin the work and provide her children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials to build a concrete wall

loans.name: Erney

texts.es: Erney, tiene la edad de 19  años, está soltero y vive con sus hermanos y sus padres. El pretende con el crédito comprar los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de una siembra de café que realizo. El cuenta con un almacigo que tiene sembrado y necesita asistirlo para su siembra en el campo donde se establecerá. El almacigo está en buenas condiciones y quiere mejorarlo para así obtener buena produccion cuando se pueda obtener cosechas. El piensa en el futuro propio y la de su familia por lo cual quiere ayudarle a su padre para alivianarle la carga con las responsabilidades de su hogar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Erney is 19 years old, single, and lives with his siblings and parents.  He plans to use this loan to buy the supplies he needs to tend to the coffee plants that he has sown.  He has a seedbed in which he has already sown his plants and he needs to tend to it so that he can then plant them out in the field.  The seedbed is in good condition and he would like to improve it so that he can obtain a good production.  Erney is thinking of his own future and also that of his family.  He would like to help his lighten his father's load by taking on some responsibilities for their household.

This is Erney's first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have given him this loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for his coffee plants

loans.name: San Miguel Arcángel Group

texts.es:
El comité San Miguel Arcangel es de ciudad de San Ignacio. Todas las integrantes del grupo son conocidas, vecina del lugar. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar en equipo, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
El deseo de ellas es que todas las integrantes cuenten con una actividad y tengan ingresos para el buen cumplimiento de sus obligaciones y logros de los objetivos del grupo.
La Sra. Librada se dedica a la venta de ropas. Ella se dedica a esto hace ya unos años, gracias a esto ha podido formar una clientela bien definida. Todos los vecinos siempre compran los productos de ella ya que trae mercaderías muy lindas. Su sueño es poder, algún día, tener un local donde ofrecer sus ropas.
Ella solicita el credito para el abastecimiento de su puesto de ropas, ya que trayendo mas variedad de ropas atraerá a mas clientes.
texts.en:
The San Miguel Arcángel Committee is from the city of San Ignacio.  All of the group's members are local women who are known in the community.  The goal of each one of them is to work as a team, to promote the spirit of solidarity, and to reach the program's highest level.  They want all of the members to have a business and the income necessary to fulfill their obligations and to achieve the group's goals.  

Librada sells clothing.  She has done this for a few years now, which has enabled her to build a solid clientele.  All of her neighbors always buy her products because she has very nice merchandise.  Her dream is to one day have a store to sell her clothing.  She is asking for a loan to stock her clothing stand, since offering a wider variety of clothing will attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothes for resale

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr: AMEYO est revendeuse de cartes de recharges et divers. Elle est à son deuxième prêt et veut renforcer son activité. Elle a démarré en 2008 de façon ambulante et achète chez les distributeurs agréés.
texts.en: Ameyo is a re-seller of top-up cards and various other products.  She is on her second loan and wants to strengthen her business.  She started in 2008 as a travelling saleswoman and buys from authorized distributors.

loans.use: To purchase top-up cards

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, tiene la edad de 47  años, está casado, vive con su hijo y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos y almacigo para su posterior siembra.
